2017-04-13.abstract: After a short hiatus, we’re back to tackling the latest popular-culture flash points: the new hit podcast from the producers of “Serial,” Jordan Peele’s comedic thriller and the furor over Kendall Jenner’s Pepsi ad.
2017-04-13.snippet: After a short hiatus, we’re back to tackling the latest popular-culture flash points: the new hit podcast from the producers of “Serial,” Jordan Peele’s comedic thriller and the furor over Kendall Jenner’s Pepsi ad.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: It has been less than a month since the podcast “S-Town” arrived, and in that time it has become a juggernaut, with millions and millions of downloads and buckets of praise. The show comes from the people behind “This American Life” and “Serial,” which had previously broken download records. In “S-Town,’’ there’s a clever bait-and-switch. Come for the promise of a murder mystery and a treasure hunt. Stay for the X-ray of a rural Alabama county and its most colorful resident, John B. McLemore.
2017-04-13.headline_main: ‘Get Out,’ ‘S-Town’ and What to Do With Our Racial Past

2017-04-13.abstract: The journalist and author of “Becoming Grandma” says Ann Patchett’s “Bel Canto” reminded her of Gabriel García Márquez, a high compliment: “My all-time favorite book . . . is ‘Love in the Time of Cholera.’”

2017-04-13.abstract: A surprised gasp during a physical exam underscores the need for better medical training on transgender health.
2017-04-13.snippet: A surprised gasp during a physical exam underscores the need for better medical training on transgender health.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: As an emergency physician, I’m always engaging in a fast-tempo, often awkward, all too stressful dance with strangers. Lately, though, I’ve noticed a particular gap in my own medical education and training, as well as in that of my colleagues, that’s further tripping up our steps: how to provide optimal health care for transgender patients.
2017-04-13.headline_main: A Transgender Learning Gap in the Emergency Room

2017-04-13.abstract: A pothole leaves the writer stranded on the Palisades Parkway, without a spare but with plenty of time to ponder how she got into this mess.
2017-04-13.snippet: A pothole leaves the writer stranded on the Palisades Parkway, without a spare but with plenty of time to ponder how she got into this mess.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: I am a little on edge because I have been to the Pothole Wars and soon I will have to go back. This is just a short-term PTSD leave after I was ambushed at the Manhattan entrance to the George Washington Bridge last week. I should have seen it coming (it is, after all pothole season) but it was a tight merge, in heavy traffic, and by the time I saw the pothole, I was in it.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Thanks for Your Service, Pothole Warrior

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — The two women who claim they were tricked into assassinating the estranged half brother of North Korea’s leader appeared in court Thursday, where their lawyers argued that Malaysia’s decision to free three North Korean suspects ended any chance of bringing the real culprits to justice.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Lawyers for Women in Kim Jong-nam Case Say They Were Scapegoated

2017-04-13.abstract: In Kosovo, fears that Serbia’s nationalists are bent on destabilizing the Balkans so that they can justify power plays in the name of restoring stability.
2017-04-13.snippet: In Kosovo, fears that Serbia’s nationalists are bent on destabilizing the Balkans so that they can justify power plays in the name of restoring stability.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: PRISTINA, Kosovo — For centuries, dark forces of history have found the Balkans a suitable proxy region for unleashing grand plans for global prominence and competition. Now, after two decades of stability and prospects for a prosperous future, Serbia again is returning to an old vocation — seeking regional hegemony. It is doing so by destabilizing the Balkans, expanding its own military and working toward economic dominance of a regional common market that Kosovo finds unacceptable and strongly opposes — all of this with Russia looking over Serbia’s shoulder.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Kosovo Feels Russia’s Heavy Hand, via Serbia

The tribute, Robbins 100, will feature 19 of his ballets.

2017-04-13.abstract: That would be for a friend to record them in the act. Also: exclusion from group texts, same-sex marriage confusion and turning down a would-be weekend guest.
2017-04-13.snippet: That would be for a friend to record them in the act. Also: exclusion from group texts, same-sex marriage confusion and turning down a would-be weekend guest.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: I’ve been dating my boyfriend for six years. We are in our 40s. Early on, we made some sex videos. They weren’t porn; they were cute and captured how much in love we were. I’m glad we did them. But lately, he wants to push our boundaries, “while we’re still young enough,” he says. He would like a friend to film us having sex. I want to make him happy, and maybe it would be fun, but I can’t get my head around it. Should I try this, or tell him to forget it?
2017-04-13.headline_main: Unsettled by a Sex Tape Request

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As a candidate, President Trump disparaged NATO as a musty relic of old thinking, an alliance focused on long-gone adversaries rather than new-era threats, a burden that drained American resources on behalf of ungrateful partners who did not pay their share. In a word: “obsolete.”
2017-04-13.headline_main: Trump’s Previous View of NATO Is Now Obsolete

2017-04-13.abstract: In “The Theater of Disappearance,” the young Argentine Adrián Villar Rojas installs his sculptures atop millenniums of art history.
2017-04-13.snippet: In “The Theater of Disappearance,” the young Argentine Adrián Villar Rojas installs his sculptures atop millenniums of art history.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Two pitfalls lie in wait for artists who win the prestigious commission to create works for the rooftop of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The obvious risk is the view, onto Central Park and the skylines of Midtown and the West Side, that can minimize or overshadow the art on display. (Cornelia Parker, the British sculptor who erected a Hitchcockian house facade, fell into that trap last year.) The other, stealthier risk is the museum below. When you are literally standing on top of five millenniums of art history, even the most assured artist can be spooked.
2017-04-13.headline_main: A Mini-Met Mashup on the Museum’s Roof, With Summer Views

2017-04-13.abstract: The country’s democracy is being tested as mistrust of the official results of the presidential election continues.
2017-04-13.snippet: The country’s democracy is being tested as mistrust of the official results of the presidential election continues.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: QUITO, Ecuador — The people — hundreds and thousands of them — took to the streets to peacefully demand a recount of the votes. Many Ecuadoreans simply did not believe the announcement of the results of the April 2 election, which gave the victory to the ruling party’s candidate, Lenin Moreno, with 51.15 percent of the vote, and said Guillermo Lasso, the Creo-Suma party candidate, received 48.85 percent.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Ecuadoreans Have the Right to a Recount

2017-04-13.abstract: “There was a very misogynist element in the coup against me,” said Dilma Rousseff, the former president of Brazil.
2017-04-13.snippet: “There was a very misogynist element in the coup against me,” said Dilma Rousseff, the former president of Brazil.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Nearly a year ago, Brazilian lawmakers voted to suspend President Dilma Rousseff from office, setting in motion the dramatic downfall of the country’s first female leader. Ms. Rousseff, a former guerrilla leader who was tortured during the country’s military dictatorship in the 1970s, was formally ousted last September. Her removal marked the end of a 13-year period of rule by the leftist Workers’ Party and a seismic shift in the country’s political trajectory. I interviewed Ms. Rousseff last weekend at the Brazil Conference at Harvard and M.I.T., during which she delivered a defiant speech warning that Brazil’s democracy is in peril. Below is a lightly edited excerpt of our conversation.
2017-04-13.headline_main: An Impeached President, Reeling but Defiant

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Emily Hurwitz, an advertising supervisor who lives in San Francisco, doesn’t like buying cars from traditional dealerships. In fact, she recently bought a 2012 Volkswagen Tiguan through Shift, a start-up that arranges online sales of used cars. 2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: New England in the mid-19th century was a literary hothouse, overgrown with wild and exotic talents. That Emily Dickinson was among the most dazzling of these is not disputable, but to say that she was obscure in her own time would exaggerate her celebrity. A handful of her poems appeared in print while she was alive (she died in 1886, at 55), but she preferred private rituals of publication, carefully writing out her verses and sewing them into booklets.

2017-04-13.snippet: It is peak season for grunion runs, when the fish race onto shore to mate and leave eggs that will develop under inches of sand.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Every year, thousands of little fish ride waves onto Southern California’s beaches at night to lay and fertilize eggs. High up in the sand, they squirm, wriggle and wrap around one another. As they dance beneath the moonlight, the beach transforms into a twinkling tapestry of spawning silver bodies. It’s known as the grunion run, and within a few hours, the show is over.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Silver Fish Surf the Waves to Spawn on California Beaches

2017-04-13.abstract: The end of the N.B.A. season proved that the Oklahoma City Thunder player is a maniac of historic proportions.
2017-04-13.snippet: The end of the N.B.A. season proved that the Oklahoma City Thunder player is a maniac of historic proportions.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: The N.B.A.’s regular season ended last night, which means that we can now say it officially: Russell Westbrook is not just an unreasonable maniac — he is an unreasonable maniac of historic proportions. His insanity is now immortal. Back at the season’s halfway point, I wrote a profile of Westbrook and his quest to achieve one of basketball’s sacred feats: to average a triple-double for an entire season. (A triple-double means registering, in one game, double digits in three different statistics, usually points, rebounds and assists.) This had happened only once in N.B.A. history, in 1962, and it seemed unlikely to ever happen again. “Averaging a triple-double,” I wrote, “is like having a helicopter that is also a boat that can also write the Great American Novel”; if Westbrook managed to pull it off, it “would be not only historic and impressive but also a little weird, almost disturbing.”
2017-04-13.headline_main: The Unreasonable Genius of Russell Westbrook

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: “Poetry / can be / the magic / carpet,” writes Bill Knott, and the exhilarating ride provided by his selected poems, “I Am Flying Into Myself,” would appear to prove it. New voices on our radar this week include Stephanie Powell Watts, whose moving update of “The Great Gatsby” features an African-American family in a declining North Carolina town, and Vivek Shanbhag, whose novella “Ghachar Ghochar” comes lauded as one of the finest works of Indian fiction in a decade. Fans of Mary Gaitskill’s fiction (“Bad Behavior,” “Veronica,” “The Mare”) will welcome her essay collection “Somebody With a Little Hammer.” And a courageous book by Ron Powers delves into his family’s struggles with schizophrenia in service of a larger goal: “to arm other families with a sense of urgency that perhaps came to us too late.”

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Funnily enough, the Museum of Modern Art has never named the long-running blockbuster show that fills its permanent-collection galleries. So I’ll name it: “Modern White Guys: The Greatest Art Story Ever Invented.” What the museum does name are the occasional temporary exhibitions that offer an alternative to that story. “Making Space: Women Artists and Postwar Abstraction” is the latest, and a stimulating alternative it is.

Warshawski, goes on a solo road trip to Kansas (where Paretsky was born and raised) with her dog, Peppy, for company and her red Bruno Magli pumps, just in case a tornado carries her off to the land of Oz.

2017-04-13.abstract: Charlie Hunnam stars in this period adventure story about love, loss and mystery in the Amazon from the director James Gray.
2017-04-13.snippet: Charlie Hunnam stars in this period adventure story about love, loss and mystery in the Amazon from the director James Gray.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: In “The Lost City of Z,” a lush, melancholic story of discovery and mystery, a mesmerizing Charlie Hunnam plays a British adventurer in the Amazon who is consumed by “all the glories of exploration,” as Joseph Conrad once wrote of a different journey. Enveloped by the forest, the explorer and his crew face snakes, piranhas, insects and that most terrifying of threats: other people, who at times bombard the strangers with arrows. Undaunted, he perseveres, venturing more deeply into a world that first becomes a passion and then something of a private hallucination. It’s 1906, and while wonders like moving pictures are rapidly shrinking the world, the dream of unknown lands endures.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Review: Hearts of Darkness and Light in ‘The Lost City of Z’

2017-04-13.snippet: John Scheinfeld’s documentary about John Coltrane draws on interviews, including those with Bill Clinton, Carlos Santana and Cornel West.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: “Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary” portrays the legendary saxophonist as a tirelessly forward-thinking artist. (His music, the philosopher Cornel West says in the film, was more of a thermostat than a thermometer.) But as a biographical movie, “Chasing Trane” sticks to a conventional, dully informative format. Its ideal venue is a Coltrane tribute event or a classroom.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Review: In ‘Chasing Trane,’ Where’s the Joy of Sax?

2017-04-13.abstract: A family ventures beyond the bubble of gentrified Brooklyn to a small town and is thrown out of its comfort zone.
2017-04-13.snippet: A family ventures beyond the bubble of gentrified Brooklyn to a small town and is thrown out of its comfort zone.
2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: “Little Boxes,” a mildly comic story about a biracial family that relocates to an exceedingly white town, feels a bit out of phase, but it’s delicately observed and does a nice job of staying within itself. It avoids the big confrontation or grand statement; doing so allows it to be an effective, if somewhat uneventful, study of the Brooklyn bubble effect.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Review: In ‘Little Boxes,’ a Biracial Family Meets a White Town

2017-04-13.headline_main: Review: ‘Maurizio Cattelan: Be Right Back’ Relishes a Mischievous Artist

2017-04-13.lead_paragraph: Bill O’Reilly is both an ambassador and a moneymaker for Fox News, his television home since 1996. His show, “The O’Reilly Factor,” which airs at 8 on weeknights, is routinely the highest-ranked show on cable news. And his blend of I-know-best commentary and pointed interviews established a genre of opinion programming that has come to dominate much of television news.
2017-04-13.headline_main: Bill O’Reilly’s World: Books, Philanthropy and Speaking Engagements

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Choate Rosemary Hall, the elite Connecticut boarding school, said on Thursday that at least 12 former teachers had sexually molested — and, in at least one case, raped — students in a pattern of abuse dating to the 1960s.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Sexual Abuse at Choate Went On for Decades, School Acknowledges

2017-04-14.abstract: After winning their fourth straight National League West title, the Dodgers fell to the Cubs in the postseason. This year, Los Angeles hopes to get past Chicago and into its first World Series since 1988.
2017-04-14.snippet: After winning their fourth straight National League West title, the Dodgers fell to the Cubs in the postseason. This year, Los Angeles hopes to get past Chicago and into its first World Series since 1988.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The cruelty of the schedule was clear to the Los Angeles Dodgers. Their new second baseman, Logan Forsythe, noticed at spring training that his teammates were buzzing about it. Of all teams, they would be the guests when the Chicago Cubs raised their World Series championship flag at Wrigley Field. The Dodgers’ season had ended here last fall when the Cubs stormed past them on their way to glory.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Latest Series Against Cubs Reminds Dodgers of World Series Drought

2017-04-14.snippet: President Trump, the first occupant of the White House never to serve in government or the military, discovers some issues are more complex than he knew.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For President Trump, the road to changing his mind on China included a discussion with corporate executives in the State Dining Room of the White House in February. When the conversation turned to China’s currency, the executives had a simple message for the president: You’re wrong.
2017-04-14.headline_main: For Trump, a Steep Learning Curve Leads to Policy Reversals

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: FRIDAY PUZZLE — In the span of nearly a year, Andrew Kingsley has made his New York Times Crossword debut and managed to have six puzzles published here. This is lucky No. 7, and it’s a nice way to start our solving weekend.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Floor Support

2017-04-14.abstract: Bartlett Sher’s masterly production of J.T. Rogers’s drama about the Oslo Accords is reborn as the colossus it was always meant to be.
2017-04-14.snippet: Bartlett Sher’s masterly production of J.T. Rogers’s drama about the Oslo Accords is reborn as the colossus it was always meant to be.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Some works of art cry out for large canvases. Though it is sparing in its use of scenery or anything approaching spectacle, J. T. Rogers’s “Oslo,” an against-the-odds story of international peacemaking, is undeniably a big play, as expansive and ambitious as any in recent Broadway history. So it is particularly gratifying to announce that it has been allowed to stretch to its full height in the thrilling production that opened on Thursday night, directed with a master’s hand by Bartlett Sher.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Review: ‘Oslo’ Fills a Large Canvas in a Thrilling Production

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Roque De La Fuente, a millionaire San Diego developer who ran unsuccessfully for president last year, would now like to be mayor of New York City. But he has already failed to win over a much smaller constituency: the co-op board of a Fifth Avenue building that rejected his $1.28 million offer. All cash.

2017-04-14.abstract: Turks overseas were asked for their views on a referendum to expand the powers of the presidency. The responses varied, but tying them together was a deep sense of concern.
2017-04-14.snippet: Turks overseas were asked for their views on a referendum to expand the powers of the presidency. The responses varied, but tying them together was a deep sense of concern.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: As Turkey heads to a referendum on Sunday to expand the powers of the presidency, Turkish voters living abroad could play an important role in the outcome. In some European countries with large Turkish populations, tensions have been high recently: Officials from President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s party, known in Turkey as the A.K.P., tried to campaign in Germany and the Netherlands and, when rebuffed, responded with a stream of harsh  insults.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Turks Across the West Wring Hands as Vote Looms

2017-04-14.headline_main: Turkish Diaspora Weighs In on Erdogan’s Bid to Bolster His Power

2017-04-14.snippet: Why has evolution preserved such a destructive emotion?
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: On Palm Sunday, two suicide bombers killed 44 worshipers at Egyptian churches. What compels someone to do such a destructive — and self-destructive — thing? The fundamental answer is simple: hate. But there’s nothing simple about hate.
2017-04-14.headline_main: The Point of Hate

2017-04-14.abstract: The revelation that some migrants are being sold as slaves adds to the urgency of an international solution to the suffering in the country.
2017-04-14.snippet: The revelation that some migrants are being sold as slaves adds to the urgency of an international solution to the suffering in the country.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Libya has become a vortex of human suffering, sucking in thousands of desperate migrants. They cross the Sahara to escape war, terrorism and destitution. Upon arrival many are held hostage by traffickers and starved, beaten and tortured. Now comes yet another level of horror, with the revelation that some are being publicly sold as slaves, according to reports by the International Organization for Migration documented this past weekend.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Another Degree of Suffering in Libya

2017-04-14.abstract: New York’s “free” tuition program is a truly bad attempt at improving higher ed.

2017-04-14.abstract: Investors still have good reason to be wary about the honesty and accuracy of audited financial statements.
2017-04-14.snippet: Investors still have good reason to be wary about the honesty and accuracy of audited financial statements.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: The reputation of KPMG, one of the Big Four accounting firms, took another hit this week, when it fired five partners, including the head of its audit practice in the United States, for “unethical behavior.” The firings come on top of existing questions about the firm’s policies and practices: KPMG has for years been the auditor of scandal-scarred Wells Fargo and was the longtime auditor of problem-plagued FIFA, the world soccer governing body. Year after year, KPMG auditors saw no evil in either company.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Auditing the Auditors

2017-04-14.abstract: The American system of filing taxes is infuriatingly complex. It could be much simpler if tax prep companies didn’t interfere.
2017-04-14.snippet: The American system of filing taxes is infuriatingly complex. It could be much simpler if tax prep companies didn’t interfere.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Ah, the blithe joys of springtime in the United States. Azaleas in bloom at the Masters, breezy picnics on balmy afternoons, Easter egg hunts — and the annual ordeal of tax forms, with helpful I.R.S. instructions like this: “Go to Part IV of Schedule I to figure line 52 if the estate or trust has qualified dividends or has a gain on lines 18a and 19 of column (2) of Schedule D (Form 1041) (as refigured for the AMT, if necessary).”
2017-04-14.headline_main: Filing Taxes in Japan Is a Breeze. Why Not Here?

2017-04-14.abstract: The Trump administration has put chemical industry toadies between our food and public safety.
2017-04-14.snippet: The Trump administration has put chemical industry toadies between our food and public safety.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: When you bite into a piece of fruit, it should be a mindless pleasure. Sure, that steroidal-looking strawberry with a toothpaste-white interior doesn’t seem right to begin with. But you shouldn’t have to think about childhood brain development when layering it over your cereal.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Poisons Are Us

2017-04-14.abstract: The president adopts a bargaining tactic that’s both nasty and stupid.
2017-04-14.snippet: The president adopts a bargaining tactic that’s both nasty and stupid.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Three weeks have passed since the Trumpcare debacle. After eight years spent denouncing the Affordable Care Act, the G.O.P. finally found itself in a position to do what it had promised, and deliver something better. But it couldn’t.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Can Trump Take Health Care Hostage?

2017-04-14.abstract: Marine Le Pen’s road to victory is clear enough. Can a pragmatist stop the extreme right?
2017-04-14.snippet: Marine Le Pen’s road to victory is clear enough. Can a pragmatist stop the extreme right?
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Paris — For some time France has been a country that does not like itself. Somewhere on the road from its humiliation in World War II to its disappointment with European integration to its discomfort with globalization, France slid into moroseness. High-speed trains purred; France pouted. Grumbling became a way of life, the response to lost grandeur. Now France seems ready to vent this slow-ripening anger in an election that could see the extreme right return to power for the first time since the 1940s and Europe revert to a turbulence not seen since that epoch.
2017-04-14.headline_main: France in the End of Days

2017-04-14.abstract: Cost-sharing reductions could make or break the Obamacare markets, and President Trump is talking about them as a possible bargaining chip.
2017-04-14.snippet: Cost-sharing reductions could make or break the Obamacare markets, and President Trump is talking about them as a possible bargaining chip.

2017-04-14.headline_main: Explaining the Health Payments That Trump Has Called ‘Ransom Money’

We wanted a picture that captured something else — her originality, her mysteriousness, her odd maturity. The mastery of shadow in this photo is amazing, and the dots, a clever nod to her synesthesia, give the whole thing a surreal beauty.”

2017-04-14.abstract: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2017-04-14.snippet: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: The beginning of this poem describes an odd thought experiment: A man wonders why he has never dreamed of being a lake and then proceeds consciously to will the dream into being. The poem is so accurate and sensory that it easy to forget how suffused it is with desire for a feeling of belonging that the man has never actually had. In this way, it is a nature poem, but also an allegory for any idealized experience never to be attained. Selected by Matthew Zapruder
2017-04-14.headline_main: Being a Lake

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: How photogenic is your home? Perhaps the question has crossed your mind in this snap-happy, hygge-obsessed Instagram era. Whether you are selling your apartment or listing it on Airbnb, a camera-ready home is a must. An inviting photograph can draw in people scrolling through listings online; a messy or disheveled room will quickly turn them off.

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: The phone rang in his study and Dwaine Perry answered with the weary resignation of a man who knew what was coming. The sun was setting on a late March evening as Mr. Perry listened to the voice on the other end of the line. “Go on,” he said, drooping his chin into his neck. Then came an extended pause, followed by a well-practiced recital of sympathies and condolences. “Well, I’ll get to work,” he finally said before hanging up. Time to plan another funeral.
2017-04-14.headline_main: The Ramapoughs vs. the World

2017-04-14.abstract: With vacant lots hard to come by and buyers clamoring for ever-larger homes, even a house built little more than a decade ago might be a candidate for a teardown.
2017-04-14.snippet: With vacant lots hard to come by and buyers clamoring for ever-larger homes, even a house built little more than a decade ago might be a candidate for a teardown.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: New development in the Hamptons used to conjure up images of lavish houses popping up in the middle of potato fields. But as more farms and vacant land are being preserved as open space, ever fewer lots are available to build new homes. And with soaring land values, coveted beachfront locations already built on and surging demand for new and bigger houses with copious amenities, teardowns in the area have become more pervasive than ever.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Razing the Hamptons

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: For weeks, the opera world has been abuzz about what the Metropolitan Opera’s new production of Richard Strauss’s “Der Rosenkavalier’’ would signify for the career of the superstar soprano Renée Fleming. In recent seasons, she has been retiring her signature roles one by one, and with this “Rosenkavalier,” Ms. Fleming, 58, is saying farewell to one of her best: Strauss’s Marschallin, an attractive, worldly-wise princess in 18th-century Vienna.

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — The ceremony of reading the Firman lasted only twenty minutes. At ten o’clock exactly Eyoub Pasha, accompanied by Mahmoud Bey Choukri, Chief of the Turkish Cabinet of the Khedive, drove up in a state carriage drawn by four horses, ascended the steps of the palace, over which a canopy was placed, and handed the Firman to the Khedive.

2017-04-14.snippet: With the surrender of stockpiles of arms comes a chance for lasting peace.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: In recent days the world has witnessed terrorist attacks on innocent citizens in Sweden and Egypt. It was thus notable, and welcome, that last weekend a militant Basque group quietly ended a decades-long reign of terror. On Saturday, in Bayonne, France, the group ETA, whose assassinations and bombings killed more than 800 people between 1968 and 2010, surrendered its stockpiles of weapons.
2017-04-14.headline_main: The Quiet End of Basque Terror

2017-04-14.abstract: Don’t listen to the critics. Turks are voting for democratic reforms.
2017-04-14.snippet: Don’t listen to the critics. Turks are voting for democratic reforms.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey — Turkish voters go to the polls on Sunday in a referendum on a new constitution that would change the system of their country’s government. The ruling Justice and Development Party, or A.K.P., introduced these amendments last December — with the support of the opposition Nationalist Movement Party — to fix flaws in the current system. Unfortunately, the government’s proposals are being taken out of context. Opponents have cast the referendum as an attempt to grab power by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan rather than what it really is: an effort to improve governance.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Turkey’s Good-Governance Referendum

2017-04-14.abstract: The creatures, relatives of the Sea Monkeys known to comic book readers of the 1970s, are emerging in New York City puddles right now.
2017-04-14.snippet: The creatures, relatives of the Sea Monkeys known to comic book readers of the 1970s, are emerging in New York City puddles right now.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: In what seems like one of Mother Nature’s fateful synchronicities, fairy shrimp capitalize on the highly temporary pools of water that most people take pains to avoid as they hike through spring woodlands. These are not the shrimp you’ll find ambling along the warm, muddy bottoms of saltwater bays; these small aquatic creatures have evolved to live in one of nature’s most transient environments. They are as short-lived as the forest pools they occupy, dwelling in these mysterious and beautiful worlds for a brief three or four months, and then both the pools and the shrimp vanish, fairylike, absorbed back into the forest floor like magic.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Careful Where You Step! Fairy Shrimp May Be Underfoot

2017-04-14.abstract: The painter and writer returns to Wichita for the first time in years to rediscover his prairie roots.
2017-04-14.snippet: The painter and writer returns to Wichita for the first time in years to rediscover his prairie roots.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Wichita, Kansas. Sodbusters, buffaloes, cowboys on long dusty cattle drives, Wyatt Earp’s jail. All that happened a long time ago. A hundred years later, I knew a landscape of tract houses, the IGA, Woolworth’s lunch counter and car lots, one after another, their boundaries marked by strings of colored flags. There were drive-in movies, Mexican restaurants and tall grain silos like sentinels along the railroad tracks. The straight black streets went on and on, stopping only at the wheat fields on the edge of town.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Going Home With the Artist David Salle

A new study by Trulia, however, suggests that the typical millennial (age 18 to 24) exceeds this amount in almost half of the country’s 25 largest rental markets.

2017-04-14.abstract: Mr. Webb’s love of photography took off in the city during the 1940s.
2017-04-14.snippet: Mr. Webb’s love of photography took off in the city during the 1940s.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: By the time Todd Webb arrived in New York City in 1945, he had lived enough lives for several men. He lost his fortune in the 1929 crash; hunted for gold in California, Mexico and Panama; worked for Chrysler in Detroit, his hometown; and served in the South Pacific as a photographer’s mate. But it was in New York where his love of photography took off, though with a slight detour.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Signs of Life in Todd Webb’s New York

2017-04-14.abstract: “Nevertheless” debuts at No. 5 on the hardcover nonfiction best-seller list.
2017-04-14.snippet: “Nevertheless” debuts at No. 5 on the hardcover nonfiction best-seller list.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Alec Baldwin’s memoir “Nevertheless” debuts at No. 5 on the hardcover nonfiction best-seller list. It follows “A Promise to Ourselves” (2008), his account of his custody fight with his former wife, Kim Basinger, and a guide for other divorcing parents. His latest was inspired by more mercenary motives: “I’m writing it because I was paid to write it.” But this is just a feint; in her review for The Times, Sarah Lyall says Baldwin makes a “sophisticated effort” to understand his origins along with, as he delicately puts it, some “incautious choices.”
2017-04-14.headline_main: Alec Baldwin Settles Scores in New Memoir

J.: Made in America” and the 10 or so hours of “Making a Murderer.” It’s time to pick up Calvin Trillin’s “Killings.”

2017-04-14.abstract: No, it’s not menial.
2017-04-14.snippet: No, it’s not menial.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: For some reason I’m suddenly getting a lot of mail about a sloppy and insensitive thing I did in passing in a blog post a while back. I was writing about what kind of work would survive digital technology, and described nursing among other things as “menial” work. What’s odd is that I have never imagined that; I don’t remember what I was thinking, but I may even have meant to say “manual” (which is also not right, however, since there’s a lot more than manual skill involved).

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: On a summer evening — any summer evening, even when the Pittsburgh breezes were kicking up a storm — he would walk a few blocks over to the park where he played as a kid, set himself down on a chair and talk about nothing in particular with Gus Kalaris. He and Gus grew up there on the North Side, fate sending Dan Rooney to the ownership of the Steelers and Kalaris to the ice ball truck his father built 83 years ago.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Dan Rooney: Pittsburgh and N.F.L. Royalty, and an Ordinary Guy

2017-04-14.abstract: Using the “mother of all bombs” in Afghanistan shouldn’t be a cause for high-fives and unseemly celebration.
2017-04-14.snippet: Using the “mother of all bombs” in Afghanistan shouldn’t be a cause for high-fives and unseemly celebration.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: When I read of the United States forces’ dropping of the second-largest non-nuclear explosive in their arsenal — the 21,000-pound GBU-43/B Massive Ordnance Air Blast (MOAB) — in eastern Afghanistan, I am reminded of what John Paul Vann, the legendary Army officer and civilian adviser during the Vietnam War, said about the right way to fight guerrillas: “This is a political war, and it calls for discrimination in killing. The best weapon for killing would be a knife, but I’m afraid we can’t do it that way. The worst is an airplane. The next worse is artillery. Barring a knife, the best is a rifle — you know who you’re killing.” An Israeli general made a similar point to me after the defeat of the second intifada, saying, “Better to fight terror with an M-16 rather than an F-16.”
2017-04-14.headline_main: Sound and Fury

2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: How passing strange. Typically, in the lead-up to Easter, Bach’s surviving Passions, the “St. John” and “St. Matthew,” each attract a performance or two in New York. But this spring, for whatever reasons, brought five major presentations of the “St. John” and none of the “St. Matthew.” And several new recordings arrived in recent weeks, all of “St. John,” as if to drive the point home.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Bach’s ‘St. John Passion’ Has More Humanity Than Anti-Semitism

2017-04-14.abstract: He’s a superstar rapper who has avoided the life of a superstar rapper. In a new HBO special, “J. Cole: 4 Your Eyez Only,” he shows fans what he’d rather think about.
2017-04-14.snippet: He’s a superstar rapper who has avoided the life of a superstar rapper. In a new HBO special, “J. Cole: 4 Your Eyez Only,” he shows fans what he’d rather think about.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Ask J. Cole about when he realized that the traditional life of a platinum rap star didn’t suit him and he’ll tell the story of the 2013 BET Awards, when a stylist dressed him in a loud Versace sweater that two other people ended up wearing on the red carpet. He’ll talk about meetings with label executives and personal heroes who encouraged him to make musical decisions that, deep down, he never felt comfortable with. He’ll recall an awakening to the potency of the love of the woman he’d been with for years. And he’ll remember his trip in the wake of the killing of Michael Brown to Ferguson, Mo., where the most valuable thing he found he could do was just to listen.
2017-04-14.headline_main: J. Cole, the Platinum Rap Dissident, Steps Back From the Spotlight

2017-04-14.snippet: For an athlete switching sports, his best years are behind him before they were ever in front of him.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: There are many aspects of baseball that set it apart from other sports. I often cite these differences as related to its pace, perspective, nuance and calculus. Yet baseball is also a game of faith, an understanding my playing days only reinforced. Inside its daily ecosystem, your beliefs are tested like in no other game. In part because it comes at you every day.
2017-04-14.headline_main: Tebow’s Test of Faith

2017-04-14.abstract: Nothing brings this sports designer joy and inspiration like the blinding outfits of some 1970s baseball teams.
2017-04-14.snippet: Nothing brings this sports designer joy and inspiration like the blinding outfits of some 1970s baseball teams.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Growing up in Yonkers, N.Y., I was, at best, an indifferent athlete. I washed out of Henry S. Richards Little League after a couple of unspectacular seasons. Later I joined the track team for a year in high school — mainly to socialize — and I still remember the uniform. In fact, I still have it. It is red and sleeveless, with white letters displayed diagonally, reading “Roosevelt.”
2017-04-14.headline_main: Why I Love Ugly Uniforms

2017-04-14.abstract: I was 16, a high school junior from rural Connecticut, where teenage boys kept their hair short and girls wore dresses that fell below their knees.
2017-04-14.snippet: I was 16, a high school junior from rural Connecticut, where teenage boys kept their hair short and girls wore dresses that fell below their knees.
2017-04-14.lead_paragraph: Clinton, N.Y. — Fifty years ago this spring, on April 15, 1967, a cold, damp Saturday morning, I walked from a friend’s apartment on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, where I’d spent the previous night, toward the Sheep Meadow in Central Park. I was 16, a junior in high school from a small town in eastern Connecticut, and eager to join my first antiwar protest, which had been organized by something called the Spring Mobilization to End the War in Vietnam (or “Mobe” for short), a recently assembled coalition of radical, pacifist and student groups. This was, in effect, my introduction to “the Sixties,” as well as to antiwar protest, for the decade had as yet barely touched rural Connecticut.
2017-04-14.headline_main: My First Antiwar Protest

2017-04-15.abstract: Justine Blainey-Broker opened the doors for girls and boys to play together. She said the American players’ bid for better pay shows progress must still be made.
2017-04-15.snippet: Justine Blainey-Broker opened the doors for girls and boys to play together. She said the American players’ bid for better pay shows progress must still be made.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — When American women’s hockey players threatened to boycott the world championship over a pay equity dispute with U.S.A. Hockey last month, their battle reopened an old wound for a 44-year-old Canadian woman.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Quest for On-Ice Equality Echoes a Fight From 30 Years Ago

2017-04-15.abstract: Let’s send one small feminist on a national tour.
2017-04-15.snippet: Let’s send one small feminist on a national tour.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Some people believe you can’t have too much of a good thing. This is the reason we have 40 different bowl games and “Star Wars” is on its seventh sequel.
2017-04-15.headline_main: ‘Fearless Girl’ Doesn’t Need Any Bull

2017-04-15.abstract: The current unrest could lead to a breakthrough if opposition groups and the international community lay out a clear plan to address the crisis.
2017-04-15.snippet: The current unrest could lead to a breakthrough if opposition groups and the international community lay out a clear plan to address the crisis.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has sought in recent days to cow crowds of protesters with barrages of rubber bullets and tear gas canisters tossed by ground forces and from helicopters. The government has deployed violence-prone plainclothes militias to discourage more demonstrators from pouring onto the streets. It has ratcheted up pressure on opponents by disqualifying a prominent leader from running for office and by detaining other critics. It has moved to censor the press by blocking access to digital news outlets, by barring foreign journalists from entering the country and by assaulting Venezuelan reporters.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Pressuring Venezuela’s Leader to Back Down

2017-04-15.abstract: A Florida teenager on vacation was among four young men who the police say were victims of members of the MS-13 gang.
2017-04-15.snippet: A Florida teenager on vacation was among four young men who the police say were victims of members of the MS-13 gang.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Jefferson Villalobos fled from gangs in Honduras three years ago and found refuge in South Florida, only to die on a family vacation on Long Island, most likely at the hands of gang members.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Eluding Gangs in Honduras, Then Falling Victim to One on Long Island

2017-04-15.abstract: By releasing its own comprehensive accounting of sexual abuse, Choate Rosemary Hall tries to control the damage that the revelations might bring.
2017-04-15.snippet: By releasing its own comprehensive accounting of sexual abuse, Choate Rosemary Hall tries to control the damage that the revelations might bring.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: For so many years, when schools learned that teachers were sexually abusing students, the strategy was to keep it quiet. Handle it in-house. Make it go away.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Choate Rosemary Hall, a Very Private School, Publicly Catalogs Its Sins

2017-04-15.abstract: There are a lot of holes in the scholarship program, but that hasn’t kept the governor out of adverb overdrive.
2017-04-15.snippet: There are a lot of holes in the scholarship program, but that hasn’t kept the governor out of adverb overdrive.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: It’s amazing what Gov. Andrew Cuomo can do when he puts his mind to it. Only last fall he seized on the idea that New York should be the first state in the nation to make tuition at its public universities and colleges free for all residents.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Mr. Cuomo’s Free* College Plan

2017-04-15.abstract: A long list of administrators at the prestigious boarding school kept sexual abuse under wraps and did not report accusations as the law required.
2017-04-15.snippet: A long list of administrators at the prestigious boarding school kept sexual abuse under wraps and did not report accusations as the law required.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: In August 1987, a former student at Choate Rosemary Hall, the prestigious Connecticut boarding school, wrote to his alumni director with a secret he had kept for decades: One of his late instructors, a man so revered that Choate had named its student center after him, liked “giving little boys back rubs in his bedroom.”
2017-04-15.headline_main: At Choate, Decades of ‘I’d Rather Let It Go at That’

2017-04-15.abstract: To potential adversaries, the bombing could signal deterrence. For the U.S. public, it underscored the Pentagon’s more aggressive stance under President Trump.
2017-04-15.snippet: To potential adversaries, the bombing could signal deterrence. For the U.S. public, it underscored the Pentagon’s more aggressive stance under President Trump.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The bomb that the United States dropped on an Islamic State cave complex in Afghanistan on Thursday was big — at 22,000 pounds, the most powerful conventional weapon in the American arsenal. Arguably, even bigger were the messages it sent, whether by design or not.
2017-04-15.headline_main: A Giant U.S. Bomb Carries an Even Bigger Message

2017-04-15.abstract: Why it took so long for the now-ubiquitous appliance, 50 years old this year, to catch on.
2017-04-15.snippet: Why it took so long for the now-ubiquitous appliance, 50 years old this year, to catch on.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year — right around the time that Kellyanne Conway, President Trump’s senior adviser, was telling us that microwave ovens could be spying on us — some friends and I rented a weekend house with no microwave oven. We didn’t mind reheating leftovers on the stove, but we did talk about how unusual it was not to have one — though in hindsight I guess we were happy that no one was watching our every move. Still, I had microwaves on my mind when I realized that 2017 is the appliance’s 50th anniversary.
2017-04-15.headline_main: What’s in Your Microwave Oven?

2017-04-15.abstract: Speaking to local reporters he had avoided since September, Jackson, the team’s president for three seasons, said the Knicks were still several years away from being a contender.
2017-04-15.snippet: Speaking to local reporters he had avoided since September, Jackson, the team’s president for three seasons, said the Knicks were still several years away from being a contender.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: GREENBURGH, N.Y. — Dressed nattily in a sports jacket and slacks for the rarest of occasions, Phil Jackson met the news media on Friday afternoon and, as we say in the trade, he made deadline.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Knicks’ Phil Jackson Breaks the Silence, but the Turmoil Is Intact

2017-04-15.abstract: Bill O’Reilly’s response to complaints about sexual harassment at Fox News prompted Ms. Kelly, a rising star at the network, to send an angry email to top executives. She later jumped to NBC.
2017-04-15.snippet: Bill O’Reilly’s response to complaints about sexual harassment at Fox News prompted Ms. Kelly, a rising star at the network, to send an angry email to top executives. She later jumped to NBC.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Last fall, in the weeks after 21st Century Fox struck settlements with two women who said that Bill O’Reilly had sexually harassed them, the Fox News host went on morning television and offered a harsh assessment of women who had come forward with complaints about the network.
2017-04-15.headline_main: O’Reilly’s Behavior Said to Have Helped Drive Megyn Kelly Out at Fox

2017-04-15.abstract: Bill de Blasio wrapped a week spent in a borough that did not vote for him in 2013, deeming the sojourn a success in terms of what he had learned.
2017-04-15.snippet: Bill de Blasio wrapped a week spent in a borough that did not vote for him in 2013, deeming the sojourn a success in terms of what he had learned.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: He ate cannoli and Sri Lankan food. He filled a pothole and took the ferry twice. He fielded 61 questions from Staten Islanders at a town-hall-style gathering on Thursday night and several more on the radio the next morning.
2017-04-15.headline_main: For Mayor de Blasio, ‘Listening Tour’ on Staten Island Yields Action

2017-04-15.abstract: Donald Trump called the federal agency “excess baggage” during his campaign, but has nominated a supporter of the bank to its board, and a fierce critic to lead it.
2017-04-15.snippet: Donald Trump called the federal agency “excess baggage” during his campaign, but has nominated a supporter of the bank to its board, and a fierce critic to lead it.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: During his campaign for president, Donald J. Trump hinted that he would get rid of the Export-Import Bank, saying that the agency that helps finance American exports was “excess baggage.”
2017-04-15.headline_main: In Reversal, Trump Names Pick to Reshape Export-Import Bank, Not End It

2017-04-15.abstract: Hundreds of defenseless women are shot to death each year by current or former partners.
2017-04-15.snippet: Hundreds of defenseless women are shot to death each year by current or former partners.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: One bit of woeful shorthand used in tallying the nation’s gun carnage is “I.P.V.” — intimate partner violence. This is a category in which each week close to 10 women are shot to death by their husbands, boyfriends or former dating partners. The victims and gunmen go unnoticed on the national scene unless the shooting turns into a larger tragedy, like the school invasion on Monday in California, in which a man murdered his wife as she taught class and, in his rampage, killed an 8-year-old student.
2017-04-15.headline_main: The One-Sided Gun War of the Sexes

2017-04-15.abstract: The United States dropped one of its most powerful bombs on a cave complex used by the Islamic State’s Afghan affiliate. How big is the extremist group’s footprint inside the country?
2017-04-15.snippet: The United States dropped one of its most powerful bombs on a cave complex used by the Islamic State’s Afghan affiliate. How big is the extremist group’s footprint inside the country?
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: The United States dropped one of its most powerful bombs on a cave complex used by the Islamic State’s Afghan affiliate. How big is the extremist group’s footprint inside the country?

2017-04-15.abstract: This year’s John Bates Clark Medal is awarded to David Donaldson, a Stanford professor. Many other recipients have gone on to win a Nobel Prize.
2017-04-15.snippet: This year’s John Bates Clark Medal is awarded to David Donaldson, a Stanford professor. Many other recipients have gone on to win a Nobel Prize.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — David Donaldson, an economist who studies the benefits of trade, a subject very much in the political spotlight, has won the prestigious John Bates Clark Medal for the most significant contributions by an economist under the age of 40.
2017-04-15.headline_main: David Donaldson, Economist Who Studies Trade Benefits, Wins Clark Medal

2017-04-15.abstract: Hardin led the Midshipmen to five straight victories over Army and later helped Temple to its first bowl-game win. He joined the College Football Hall of Fame in 2013.
2017-04-15.snippet: Hardin led the Midshipmen to five straight victories over Army and later helped Temple to its first bowl-game win. He joined the College Football Hall of Fame in 2013.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Wayne Hardin, a Hall of Fame football coach who built standout programs at the United States Naval Academy and Temple University, leading Navy to victory over Army five times in a row and Temple to its first bowl-game win, died on Wednesday in Abington, Pa. He was 91.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Wayne Hardin, Hall of Fame Football Coach at Navy, Dies at 91

2017-04-15.abstract: Days before the State of Arkansas is scheduled to execute two men -- the first of seven in 10 days -- a lawyer for one of the nation's largest companies accused the state's prison system of deception when it bought 100 vials of vecuronium bromide, which can be used to stop a prisoner's breathing.
2017-04-15.snippet: Days before the State of Arkansas is scheduled to execute two men -- the first of seven in 10 days -- a lawyer for one of the nation's largest companies accused the state's prison system of deception when it bought 100 vials of vecuronium bromide,...

2017-04-15.abstract: As a microbiologist, he found that the drug Lamivudine was effective against H.I.V., and he later became a global champion of AIDS treatment and awareness.
2017-04-15.snippet: As a microbiologist, he found that the drug Lamivudine was effective against H.I.V., and he later became a global champion of AIDS treatment and awareness.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Dr. Mark Wainberg, a microbiologist who identified a drug that later became critical to treating people infected with H.I.V., and who later became a leading advocate for giving millions of people with H.I.V. and AIDS in Africa greater access to antiretroviral drugs, died on Tuesday after struggling in the waters off Bal Harbour, Fla. He was 71.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Dr. Mark Wainberg, Who Identified a Key AIDS Drug, Dies at 71

2017-04-15.abstract: Mr. Golin was a young press agent when he made a cold call to Ray Kroc in 1957 that began a 60-year relationship and helped turn the fast-food restaurant with the golden arches into a household word.
2017-04-15.snippet: Mr. Golin was a young press agent when he made a cold call to Ray Kroc in 1957 that began a 60-year relationship and helped turn the fast-food restaurant with the golden arches into a household word.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: In 1955, a Chicago milkshake-machine salesman was so impressed by a California client’s assembly-line-style restaurant that he bought the franchising rights and opened his own hamburger stand modeled after it in suburban Des Plaines, Ill.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Al Golin, PR Man Whose Vision Helped Make McDonald’s a Success, Dies at 87

2017-04-15.abstract: Mr. Ballhaus, who was nominated for three Academy Awards, was a favorite of Martin Scorsese, Rainer Werner Fassbinder and other notable directors.

2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Michael Ballhaus, a cinematographer who brought lyricism and light to films by Martin Scorsese, Rainer Werner Fassbinder and a string of other eminent directors, died on Tuesday at his home in Berlin. He was 81.

2017-04-15.snippet: Chapman, who faced the Cardinals often with the Reds and the Cubs, had not given up a run to St. Louis in more than five years.

2017-04-15.abstract: The profound reordering of New York’s shopping scene reflects a broad restructuring in the American retail industry.
2017-04-15.snippet: The profound reordering of New York’s shopping scene reflects a broad restructuring in the American retail industry.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Along the cobblestone streets of SoHo, Chanel handbags and Arc’teryx jackets are displayed in shops like museum pieces, harking back to the height of the neighborhood’s trendiness. But rents there are softening, and the number of vacant storefronts is rising.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Is American Retail at a Historic Tipping Point?

2017-04-15.abstract: "The Hairy Ape" at the Park Avenue Armory uses a turntable stage that rotates around the audience and, at 140 feet in diameter, is the largest in the modern history of New York theater. In this 360 video, hop on for one of the rotations.

2017-04-15.snippet: Physical temples to commerce remain, but today the online experience is rapidly changing our relationship with shopping.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: The way we choose to shop, and the way retailers decide to sell us things, is an ever evolving relationship. And as new ideas emerge and come to dominate (“It’s one place with everything — a department store!”) they inevitably fall out of favor and give way to the next brainstorm (think Amazon’s 1-Click).
2017-04-15.headline_main: From ‘Zombie Malls’ to Bonobos: What America’s Retail Transformation Looks Like

2017-04-15.abstract: At Nerdstrong in Los Angeles, fans of “Star Wars,” “The Lord of the Rings” and classic arcade games can work out with familiar narratives.
2017-04-15.snippet: At Nerdstrong in Los Angeles, fans of “Star Wars,” “The Lord of the Rings” and classic arcade games can work out with familiar narratives.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The first sign of what is to come at Nerdstrong Gym in North Hollywood is the red welcome mat: It’s in the shape of a Dungeons & Dragons 10-sided die. The equipment inside includes 25-pound steel clubs (for the potions class portion of a Harry Potter workout, among others). A gray concrete wall is painted with pixelated Space Invaders from the 1970s video game. And the gym’s handbook reassures members that workouts can be scaled from Padawan to Jedi Master (that’s Star Wars for “pretty easy” to “really hard”).
2017-04-15.headline_main: A Gym Where Comic-Con Is the Reigning Spirit

2017-04-15.abstract: Fired from her job with the French fashion brand, Ms. Chiquet emerged with a new career plan and a new relationship.
2017-04-15.snippet: Fired from her job with the French fashion brand, Ms. Chiquet emerged with a new career plan and a new relationship.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: PURCHASE, N.Y. — On the first floor of Maureen Chiquet’s sprawling home here — past the Kiki Smith bronze nude of a man jutting from a wall and the Dustin Yellin sculpture in the foyer; past the dining room with its “casual” crystal chandelier from a Paris antique market — is a sunroom-turned-meditation room bathed in natural light with a few large pillows scattered around the floor and a Buddha’s head on a low table.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Maureen Chiquet’s Move From Chanel to Self-Empowerment
