2017-04-15.abstract: Mike Isaac and Nicole Perlroth discuss the week’s technology news, including Burger King’s latest stunt with Google Home devices.
2017-04-15.snippet: Mike Isaac and Nicole Perlroth discuss the week’s technology news, including Burger King’s latest stunt with Google Home devices.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Farhad is out this week, so Nicole Perlroth, a Times cybersecurity reporter, is filling in.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Mike and Nicole’s Week in Tech: United’s Troubles and Burger King’s ‘Hack’

2017-04-15.abstract: The landlord forgot to mention that the toilet won’t flush toilet paper. Is that grounds for breaking a lease?
2017-04-15.snippet: The landlord forgot to mention that the toilet won’t flush toilet paper. Is that grounds for breaking a lease?
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Q.  Hours after we moved into our new apartment in Queens — and days after we signed the lease — the landlord informed us that there was a problem with the plumbing. Because of narrow pipes, toilet paper cannot be flushed down the toilet. Instead, wet and soiled squares must go in the trash. Had the landlord or the broker mentioned this beforehand, we wouldn’t have chosen this apartment. Was he obliged to disclose it? Do we have grounds to break the lease?
2017-04-15.headline_main: Plumbing Problems

2017-04-15.abstract: Alphabet and Facebook are growth stocks, sure. But MasterCard, Domino’s and Sherwin-Williams are also in growth fund portfolios.
2017-04-15.snippet: Alphabet and Facebook are growth stocks, sure. But MasterCard, Domino’s and Sherwin-Williams are also in growth fund portfolios.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Growth stocks — those whose earnings are expected to grow faster than average — surged in the first quarter. They carried with them the managers of several of the quarter’s top-performing stock funds.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Finding Growth in Pizza, Paint and Credit-Card Companies

2017-04-15.abstract: German officials believe that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, whose power could be expanded by a vote on Sunday, is using a decades-old arrangement between the countries to spy on opponents.
2017-04-15.snippet: German officials believe that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, whose power could be expanded by a vote on Sunday, is using a decades-old arrangement between the countries to spy on opponents.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: COLOGNE, Germany — The impressive Islamic complex here, Germany’s largest, boasts towering minarets and a soaring prayer hall. But what Turkish officials here seem most proud of are the hundreds of windows, which allow outsiders and Muslim worshipers to glimpse each other’s worlds. The idea, they say, is transparency.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Referendum Inflames Concerns Over Turkey’s Grip in Germany

2017-04-15.abstract: The women of Bihar State, one of India’s poorest, have enthusiastically welcomed a strict prohibition law, and often take matters into their own hands.
2017-04-15.snippet: The women of Bihar State, one of India’s poorest, have enthusiastically welcomed a strict prohibition law, and often take matters into their own hands.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: BANDOL, India — Dozens of women brandishing brooms swooped down on a straw house in this village on a recent Saturday, sending the owner fleeing through a rice field as they seized buckets of fruit juice being fermented into a cheap liquor.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Alcohol Ban Succeeds as Women Warn, ‘Behave, or We’ll Get Tough’

2017-04-15.abstract: The best road team in the N.H.L. continues its playoff series at Madison Square Garden, where the crowd noise hits impressive levels only on occasion.
2017-04-15.snippet: The best road team in the N.H.L. continues its playoff series at Madison Square Garden, where the crowd noise hits impressive levels only on occasion.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: The Rangers produced two more high-energy games last week on the road, which should come as no surprise to anyone following that hockey team’s odd performance pattern this season. Now there may be trouble, however, because the Rangers’ first-round playoff series against the Montreal Canadiens is moving from an electric atmosphere inside Bell Centre to an arena where it is far too easy to hear the puck drop during a third-period face-off.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Rangers’ Challenge Is to Match the Canadiens’ Decibel Level

2017-04-15.abstract: Supporters say the plan would limit “frivolous lawsuits” and cut health costs; critics say it would take rights away from patients served by federal programs.
2017-04-15.snippet: Supporters say the plan would limit “frivolous lawsuits” and cut health costs; critics say it would take rights away from patients served by federal programs.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Low-income people and older Americans would find it more difficult to win lawsuits for injuries caused by medical malpractice or defective drugs or medical devices under a bill drafted by House Republicans as part of their plan to replace the Affordable Care Act.
2017-04-15.headline_main: G.O.P. Bill Would Make Medical Malpractice Suits Harder to Win

2017-04-15.abstract: The giraffe you’ve been waiting for made its long-awaited debut on a live stream that has, over the past few months, drawn millions of viewers.
2017-04-15.snippet: The giraffe you’ve been waiting for made its long-awaited debut on a live stream that has, over the past few months, drawn millions of viewers.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: April, a giraffe who became an internet sensation after her pregnancy was live-streamed from the rural New York hamlet where she lives, has finally given birth, ending months of speculation and excitement for her online audience.
2017-04-15.headline_main: April the Giraffe, an Internet Star, Gives Birth. Finally.

2017-04-15.abstract: Coal ash, a largely unseen byproduct of electricity production, is leaking from storage ponds, two lawsuits contend, and could be threatening the drinking water of more than a million people.
2017-04-15.snippet: Coal ash, a largely unseen byproduct of electricity production, is leaking from storage ponds, two lawsuits contend, and could be threatening the drinking water of more than a million people.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: GALLATIN, Tenn. — The hulking Gallatin Fossil Plant sits on a scenic bend of the Cumberland River about 30 miles upstream from Nashville. In addition to generating electricity, the plant, built in the early 1950s by the Tennessee Valley Authority, produces more than 200,000 tons of coal residue a year. That coal ash, mixed with water and sluiced into pits and ponds on the plant property, has been making its way into groundwater and the river, potentially threatening drinking water supplies, according to two current lawsuits.
2017-04-15.headline_main: 2 Tennessee Cases Bring Coal’s Hidden Hazard to Light

2017-04-15.abstract: Guo Wengui, a real estate magnate now living abroad, has described a fierce business struggle that he says reveals corruption in the party’s top ranks.
2017-04-15.snippet: Guo Wengui, a real estate magnate now living abroad, has described a fierce business struggle that he says reveals corruption in the party’s top ranks.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: It happens in Russia — occasionally. An oligarch, made fabulously wealthy through the privatization of state assets, breaks ranks, becoming a critic of President Vladimir V. Putin.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Greater Corruption in China? A Billionaire Says He Has Evidence

2017-04-15.abstract: No current combination of catcher and starting pitcher has lasted longer than the Cardinals’ Yadier Molina and Adam Wainwright.
2017-04-15.snippet: No current combination of catcher and starting pitcher has lasted longer than the Cardinals’ Yadier Molina and Adam Wainwright.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: They are the timeless battery of baseball, the one that keeps going and going. No current combination of catcher and starting pitcher has lasted longer than Yadier Molina and Adam Wainwright, who will start for the St. Louis Cardinals at Yankee Stadium on Sunday night.
2017-04-15.headline_main: A Baseball Battery That Hasn’t Lost Its Charge

2017-04-15.abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon provide us with sage advice.
2017-04-15.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon provide us with sage advice.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Good morning, class. Today we learn how to pick up a STING RAY. Have we covered that yet?
2017-04-15.headline_main: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic

2017-04-15.abstract: Growers are moving to large farms in the Salinas Valley, threatening the state’s smaller cannabis farmers and inspiring fears of a glut.
2017-04-15.snippet: Growers are moving to large farms in the Salinas Valley, threatening the state’s smaller cannabis farmers and inspiring fears of a glut.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: SALINAS, Calif. — This vast and fertile valley is often called the salad bowl of the nation for the countless heads of lettuce growing across its floor. Now California’s marijuana industry is laying claim to a new slogan for the valley: America’s cannabis bucket.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Marijuana Goes Industrial in California

2017-04-15.abstract: With a legal fight unfolding over a series of scheduled executions, Mr. Echols makes a rare trip back to the state where he spent 18 years on death row.
2017-04-15.snippet: With a legal fight unfolding over a series of scheduled executions, Mr. Echols makes a rare trip back to the state where he spent 18 years on death row.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: LITTLE ROCK — One by one, the speakers at the anti-death-penalty rally took a turn behind the lectern on the Capitol steps. Hundreds listened as they spoke of light and its unique ability to drive out the darkness. Then there was a stir off to the side.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Damien Echols Says He Is Proof Arkansas Sends ‘Innocent People to Death’

2017-04-15.abstract: Attacks on two churches that killed 45 people remind Copts of a 2011 bombing that has never been solved.
2017-04-15.snippet: Attacks on two churches that killed 45 people remind Copts of a 2011 bombing that has never been solved.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt — When the bomb went off at St. Mark’s Cathedral one week ago, William Frances had one thought: “Oh, my God, it’s happening again.”
2017-04-15.headline_main: After Church Bombings, Egyptian Christians Are Resigned but Resolute

2017-04-15.abstract: Pierre McGuire, who originated the “Inside the Glass” role on NBC, is broadcasting eight games in eight days in six cities to open the playoffs.
2017-04-15.snippet: Pierre McGuire, who originated the “Inside the Glass” role on NBC, is broadcasting eight games in eight days in six cities to open the playoffs.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: The scene plays out before every NBC hockey telecast. Pierre McGuire practically bounces onto the ice for the short walk to his broadcasting post between the benches. He is a bundle of energy as he watches warm-ups, conducts a player interview during the pregame show and waits for the opening puck to drop.
2017-04-15.headline_main: NBC’s Fixture Between the Benches Begins His Playoff Sprint

2017-04-15.abstract: As the president has soured on Stephen K. Bannon, Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump have emerged as President Trump’s most important advisers, at least for now.
2017-04-15.snippet: As the president has soured on Stephen K. Bannon, Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump have emerged as President Trump’s most important advisers, at least for now.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One has an office down the hall from the president in the White House; the other just moved into an office a floor up. One recently visited war-torn Iraq as the president’s emissary; the other will soon head to Berlin at the invitation of Germany’s chancellor.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump: Pillars of Family-Driven West Wing

2017-04-15.abstract: President Trump is populating the federal government with former lobbyists who in many cases are influencing policy in industries where they were recently paid.
2017-04-15.snippet: President Trump is populating the federal government with former lobbyists who in many cases are influencing policy in industries where they were recently paid.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump is populating the White House and federal agencies with former lobbyists, lawyers and consultants who in many cases are helping to craft new policies for the same industries in which they recently earned a paycheck.
2017-04-15.headline_main: With Trump Appointees, a Raft of Potential Conflicts and ‘No Transparency’

2017-04-15.abstract: The inquiry, which targets many prominent Americans, was announced a day before a national referendum to expand the powers of Turkey’s president.
2017-04-15.snippet: The inquiry, which targets many prominent Americans, was announced a day before a national referendum to expand the powers of Turkey’s president.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — A Turkish prosecutor has opened an investigation into 17 people accused of fomenting last year’s failed coup, including many prominent American officials, academics and politicians, state news media reported on Saturday.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Turkey Investigating 17, Some Americans, Accused in Failed Coup

2017-04-15.abstract: The number of Mexicans kicked out of the United States actually fell at the start of President Trump’s term, but politicians and others in Mexico have seized on the issue.
2017-04-15.snippet: The number of Mexicans kicked out of the United States actually fell at the start of President Trump’s term, but politicians and others in Mexico have seized on the issue.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexico’s president dashed to the airport to greet a planeload of deportees. The education minister rushed to the Texas border to meet Mexicans being kicked out of the United States. Mexico City’s labor secretary is urging companies to hire migrants who abruptly find themselves sent back home.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Mexican Deportees, Once Ignored Back Home, Now Find ‘Open Arms’

2017-04-15.abstract: We can learn so much from captains of industry, especially from their mistakes. Expert apology-watchers take a cold look at statements from Travis Kalanick and William Ackman.
2017-04-15.snippet: We can learn so much from captains of industry, especially from their mistakes. Expert apology-watchers take a cold look at statements from Travis Kalanick and William Ackman.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Everybody loves getting an apology. Nobody enjoys making one, especially in public life, where leaders tend to see admitting an error as a sign of weakness.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Apologies. Really. And I Will Definitely Grow Up.

2017-04-15.abstract: It was the last time anyone saw what’s left of Capt. Bill Curtis, who changed saltwater fly-fishing and inspired characters in books.
2017-04-15.snippet: It was the last time anyone saw what’s left of Capt. Bill Curtis, who changed saltwater fly-fishing and inspired characters in books.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: ISLAMORADA, Fla. — Nobody knows for certain why someone would steal the cremated remains of a Florida Keys fly-fishing legend from a pickup truck parked outside a restaurant earlier this year.
2017-04-15.headline_main: The One That Got Away: Theft of Fishing Guide’s Ashes Becomes a Whodunit

2017-04-15.abstract: An exhibition at the Guggenheim Museum will include an aroma derived from Asian-American women and ants, and bacteria from Manhattan’s Chinatown and Koreatown.
2017-04-15.snippet: An exhibition at the Guggenheim Museum will include an aroma derived from Asian-American women and ants, and bacteria from Manhattan’s Chinatown and Koreatown.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: With their unlikely combinations of beauty, science, organic material and occasional living things, Anicka Yi’s works rarely fail to intrigue, provoke and delight. Her titles can range from the abstruse to the sinister, as with “7,070,430K of Digital Spit,” seen at the Kunsthalle Basel in 2015. On Friday, April 21, the Guggenheim Museum will unveil “Life Is Cheap,” an exhibition honoring Ms. Yi’s receipt of its 2016 Hugo Boss Prize.
2017-04-15.headline_main: The Beauty of Bacteria: Anicka Yi’s ‘Life Is Cheap’

2017-04-15.abstract: Math can make our brains light up in the same way art and music do.
2017-04-15.snippet: Math can make our brains light up in the same way art and music do.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: I was doing KenKen, a math puzzle, on a plane recently when a fellow passenger asked why I bothered. I said I did it for the beauty.
2017-04-15.headline_main: The World’s Most Beautiful Mathematical Equation

2017-04-15.abstract: Readers mostly disagree with an essay asserting that such nostalgia “misplaced” and efforts to save Main Street misguided.
2017-04-15.snippet: Readers mostly disagree with an essay asserting that such nostalgia “misplaced” and efforts to save Main Street misguided.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-04-15.headline_main: Our Nostalgia for Main Street

2017-04-15.abstract: Practically every president has kept animals in the Executive Mansion. Its current occupant would be wise to do the same.
2017-04-15.snippet: Practically every president has kept animals in the Executive Mansion. Its current occupant would be wise to do the same.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Of all the stains besmirching the Trump presidency — the ethical lacunae, the spasmodic “policy” fits, the Golf Digest aesthetic — none looms so large as the absence of a White House pet. Breathes there a man with a soul so dead that he doesn’t want a loyal dog or faithful feline trotting beside him when he mounts that lonely staircase to the venerable Master Bedroom?
2017-04-15.headline_main: What Kind of Pet Should Donald Trump Get?

2017-04-15.abstract: A plan to run a road through a patch of open, wild land on the outskirts of town reveals the transitory beauty of life on the edge.
2017-04-15.snippet: A plan to run a road through a patch of open, wild land on the outskirts of town reveals the transitory beauty of life on the edge.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Yorkshire, England — A few mornings back, after another week of waking each day in disbelief at the news feeds on my phone, I rose early, pulled on my clothes and headed out into the darkness. There’s a place I always go when I feel like this. Crossing over the highway, weaving through the masses of housing and the still-sleeping suburbs, I sensed it rising behind the low walls and privet hedges on the outskirts of town like a great wave — that strange space beyond the streetlights; the tangled, messy border where human and nature collide and collude. Edgeland.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Where Nature Gets to Run Amok

2017-04-15.abstract: Woe to the Washington aide unschooled in self-effacement.
2017-04-15.snippet: Woe to the Washington aide unschooled in self-effacement.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: If you’re any student of politics, you saw Steve Bannon on the cover of Time magazine in early February — “The Great Manipulator,” it called him — and knew to start the countdown then.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Steve Bannon Was Doomed

2017-04-15.abstract: Defensiveness makes you a better, more skeptical reader — a critic.
2017-04-15.snippet: Defensiveness makes you a better, more skeptical reader — a critic.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Here’s a reading challenge: Pick up a book you’re pretty sure you won’t like — the style is wrong, the taste not your own, the author bio unappealing. You might even take it one step further. Pick up a book you think you will hate, of a genre you’ve dismissed since high school, written by an author you’re inclined to avoid. Now read it to the last bitter page.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Why You Should Read Books You Hate

2017-04-15.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau wants to legalize the drug. Attorney General Jeff Sessions feels differently.
2017-04-15.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau wants to legalize the drug. Attorney General Jeff Sessions feels differently.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: A majority of Americans and Canadians believe that marijuana should be legal. The governments of the two countries, however, appear to be moving in very different directions.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Canada, but Not Jeff Sessions, Moves Boldly on Marijuana

2017-04-15.abstract: There’s one clear pattern in his history of making promises: betrayal.
2017-04-15.snippet: There’s one clear pattern in his history of making promises: betrayal.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump has made so many promises, from wiping out the national debt — a pledge dismissed last week by his own budget director as “hyperbole” — to changing the name of the Denali peak back to Mount McKinley, that it can be hard to keep track of how many he’s breaking. So here’s a partial list of his reversals and revisions, large and small, to date:
2017-04-15.headline_main: Mr. Trump’s 10-Second Convictions

2017-04-15.abstract: I asked the longtime Sunday School teacher if we really need to believe that Jesus rose from the dead.
2017-04-15.snippet: I asked the longtime Sunday School teacher if we really need to believe that Jesus rose from the dead.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Christians celebrate Easter on Sunday. But wait — do we really think Jesus literally rose from the dead?
2017-04-15.headline_main: President Carter, Am I a Christian?

2017-04-15.abstract: Outside the classroom, we inhabit the same world.
2017-04-15.snippet: Outside the classroom, we inhabit the same world.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: For black students, having even one black teacher can make a huge difference. That’s the conclusion of a new study, which found that that black boys who had a black teacher during their elementary school years were less likely to drop out of high school. It also linked the presence of black teachers to kids’ expectations of attending college.
2017-04-15.headline_main: The Real Reason Black Kids Benefit From Black Teachers

2017-04-15.abstract: The long and bloody history of fighting over dictionary definitions.
2017-04-15.snippet: The long and bloody history of fighting over dictionary definitions.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Americans can’t agree on much these days. They’ve obviously fallen out over politics. They can’t even agree on the facts. Now they’re fighting over words.
2017-04-15.headline_main: America’s Uncivil War Over Words

2017-04-15.abstract: In religion and politics, we have lost sight of a key trait.
2017-04-15.snippet: In religion and politics, we have lost sight of a key trait.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Over breakfast with a social psychologist I know, I asked him what constructive contribution Christians could make to public life. An atheist who finds much to admire in religion, he answered simply: “Humility.”
2017-04-15.headline_main: The Quiet Power of Humility

2017-04-15.abstract: Have you actually read it? It’s neither offensive nor even particularly conservative.
2017-04-15.snippet: Have you actually read it? It’s neither offensive nor even particularly conservative.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: The talk that the political scientist Charles Murray attempted to deliver last month at Middlebury College in Vermont must have been quite provocative — perhaps even offensive or an instance of hate speech. How else to explain the vehement opposition to it?
2017-04-15.headline_main: Charles Murray’s ‘Provocative’ Talk

2017-04-15.abstract: In Alabama politics, swampy ethics are a tradition. But the past year has been especially sordid.
2017-04-15.snippet: In Alabama politics, swampy ethics are a tradition. But the past year has been especially sordid.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — Another governor was arrested last week in Alabama. It happens not infrequently. With guilty pleas on two misdemeanors on Monday, Robert J. Bentley, the “Love Gov,” became the third Alabama governor in the last six to be convicted of a crime. He resigned; the new governor has not been arrested for anything so far.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Crooks, Swindlers and Sex Hounds

2017-04-15.abstract: ​Two young refugees bond over a science experiment.​
2017-04-15.snippet: ​Two young refugees bond over a science experiment.​
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: ​Two young refugees bond over a science experiment.​
2017-04-15.headline_main: Most Kids Don't Know Where Syria Is

2017-04-15.abstract: Why America needs its ex-Protestants to go back to church.
2017-04-15.snippet: Why America needs its ex-Protestants to go back to church.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: OUR intervention in Syria required me to be fully serious last Sunday, but now it’s time to return to this column’s ongoing series of implausible proposals, Easter Sunday edition. Which means I’ll be proposing — yes, I’m that predictable — that many of this newspaper’s secular liberal readers should head en masse to church.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Save the Mainline

2017-04-15.abstract: A series of contretemps, including a player’s boycott and a rules imbroglio, have placed the tour squarely in the intersection of politics and sport.
2017-04-15.snippet: A series of contretemps, including a player’s boycott and a rules imbroglio, have placed the tour squarely in the intersection of politics and sport.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Mike Whan sat in a ninth-floor ballroom at the New York Athletic Club, his legs jiggling under the circular 10-seat table. Sitting still has never been Whan’s strong suit, which partly explains his success as the Ladies Professional Golf Association commissioner. But on Thursday, Whan’s fidgetiness was fed by the feeling — a familiar one during his eventful eight-year tenure — that he needed to be in two places at once.
2017-04-15.headline_main: For L.P.G.A. Commissioner Mike Whan, Politics Become Part of the Game

2017-04-15.abstract: The Times’s standards editor explains our policies on identifying the alleged victims and perpetrators of sexual misconduct.
2017-04-15.snippet: The Times’s standards editor explains our policies on identifying the alleged victims and perpetrators of sexual misconduct.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: “Who” is the first of the five “W” questions drilled into the head of every aspiring reporter. But in a range of situations, Times reporters and editors wrestle with whether to include that basic fact in a story — the name of the person we’re writing about.
2017-04-15.headline_main: When We Name Names

2017-04-15.abstract: How a tweet about the Easter Egg Roll led to a torrent of vitriol from the president’s supporters — and a front page story.
2017-04-15.snippet: How a tweet about the Easter Egg Roll led to a torrent of vitriol from the president’s supporters — and a front page story.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: My first hint that the White House Easter Egg Roll in the age of President Trump might be a fraught subject came, fittingly, through Mr. Trump’s favorite medium: Twitter.
2017-04-15.headline_main: My Own Private Easter Egg-Gate

2017-04-15.abstract: The bomb attack interrupted a deal between the government and the rebels to evacuate people from four villages that have suffered prolonged sieges.
2017-04-15.snippet: The bomb attack interrupted a deal between the government and the rebels to evacuate people from four villages that have suffered prolonged sieges.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Dozens of people were killed in the Syrian city of Aleppo on Saturday when a car bomb struck a group of buses carrying residents and fighters who had been evacuated from two besieged towns the day before.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Dozens Killed as Blast Strikes Convoy Carrying Evacuated Syrians

2017-04-15.abstract: A dump that collapsed on a residential neighborhood on Friday killed at least 19, buried scores of homes and sent many more residents fleeing.
2017-04-15.snippet: A dump that collapsed on a residential neighborhood on Friday killed at least 19, buried scores of homes and sent many more residents fleeing.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka — Rescue workers in Sri Lanka’s capital city on Saturday dug through the debris of a garbage dump that collapsed on top of a residential neighborhood a day earlier, burying scores of homes and killing at least 19 people.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Sri Lanka Garbage Dump Collapse Kills at Least 19

2017-04-15.abstract: A surge in commodity prices fueled a powerful rally in emerging-market stocks. But any further advances may have to come from other factors.
2017-04-15.snippet: A surge in commodity prices fueled a powerful rally in emerging-market stocks. But any further advances may have to come from other factors.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Propelled by a rebound in commodity prices, emerging market stocks have roared back over the last year. But if the sector is to continue to prosper, many fund managers say, it will need to be fueled by other factors.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Emerging Market Stocks Have Come Roaring Back. Can They Go Any Higher?

2017-04-15.abstract: St. Louis pitcher Carlos Martinez neutralized his 11-strikeout performance with eight walks, throwing 118 pitches in the Yankees’ sixth straight victory.
2017-04-15.snippet: St. Louis pitcher Carlos Martinez neutralized his 11-strikeout performance with eight walks, throwing 118 pitches in the Yankees’ sixth straight victory.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Two diametrically opposed pitching performances, one sublime and the other ridiculous, were on display at Yankee Stadium on Saturday, and both helped the Yankees extend their winning streak to six games.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Yankees Outlast a Jekyll-and-Hyde Starter to Beat the Cardinals

2017-04-15.abstract: Timothy Polin takes us for a ride.
2017-04-15.snippet: Timothy Polin takes us for a ride.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — What’s better on a Sunday than getting out into the fresh air, mounting your trusty steed and galloping along the beach with your hair swept back by the wind?
2017-04-15.headline_main: Saddle Up

2017-04-15.abstract: Despite the Trump administration’s support for coal and other carbon fuels, there is a reasonable case for investing in renewable energy.
2017-04-15.snippet: Despite the Trump administration’s support for coal and other carbon fuels, there is a reasonable case for investing in renewable energy.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: Alternative energy investments like wind and solar power have not performed well in recent years. To make matters worse, the Trump administration has opted for a resurgence of coal and other carbon fuels, not an emphasis on alternative energy.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Investing in Solar and Wind in a Coal and Oil Moment

2017-04-15.abstract: The group, which calls itself the Shadow Brokers, said the agency had broken into the international bank messaging system called Swift.
2017-04-15.snippet: The group, which calls itself the Shadow Brokers, said the agency had broken into the international bank messaging system called Swift.
2017-04-15.lead_paragraph: For the past few months, an elite hacking group calling itself the Shadow Brokers has sporadically leaked sensitive data from the National Security Agency. On Friday, just when its leaks had appeared to slow, the group released what appears to be its most damaging leak so far: a trove of highly classified hacking tools used to break into various Microsoft systems, along with what it said was evidence that the N.S.A. had infiltrated the backbone of the Middle East’s banking infrastructure.
2017-04-15.headline_main: Hacking Group Claims N.S.A. Infiltrated Mideast Banking System

2017-04-16.abstract: Maia finally finds the boldness to start making her mark. Her father doesn’t lack that trait.
2017-04-16.snippet: Maia finally finds the boldness to start making her mark. Her father doesn’t lack that trait.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: “Chaos” is an all too apt title for the Season 1 finale of “The Good Fight.” It’s an obvious reference to the fraught position the firm’s members find themselves in, both personally and professionally. But there is also a tinge of disorder to the way the episode is constructed. It vacillates between ever-expanding, dense subplots that require a steady hand to pull off. While the show’s creators do manage to bring their ambitious aims to fruition, the characters most in need of interiority — namely Lucca and Barbara — are once again left to be merely marginal figures. In many ways, “Chaos” acts as the perfect encapsulation of the series itself: brazenly political and masterly at suspense, but sometimes ambitious in all the wrong ways.
2017-04-16.headline_main: 'The Good Fight’ Season 1 Finale Recap: Trojan Horses

2017-04-16.abstract: The actor talks about his new book, which details his “always-changing, ever-fascinating” relationship to spirituality, and particularly Judaism.
2017-04-16.snippet: The actor talks about his new book, which details his “always-changing, ever-fascinating” relationship to spirituality, and particularly Judaism.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: You might know the name Stephen Tobolowsky. If not, I promise you know his face. His more than 250 acting credits include dozens of TV series (including current work on “Silicon Valley” and “One Day at a Time”) and movies like “Mississippi Burning” and “Memento.” To fans of “Groundhog Day,” he is seared into memory (“Bing!”) as Ned Ryerson, the insurance salesman who repeatedly accosts Bill Murray’s Phil Connors. He’s also an author, and his new book, “My Adventures With God,” is the story of his lifelong relationship to spirituality, and particularly Judaism, told through reflections of his time growing up in Texas, his early years as an actor and his becoming a husband and father. Below, Mr. Tobolowsky tells us about the inspiration for the book, what he learned while writing it and more.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Stephen Tobolowsky’s ‘My Adventures With God’

2017-04-16.abstract: After breaking up a potential no-hitter in the eighth inning and rallying for two runs to tie the game in the top of the ninth, the Mets lost on a J.T. Riddle home run.
2017-04-16.snippet: After breaking up a potential no-hitter in the eighth inning and rallying for two runs to tie the game in the top of the ninth, the Mets lost on a J.T. Riddle home run.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — The Mets’ tiring weekend here began Thursday with a 16-inning win that did not end until Friday morning. The hangover effect on the bullpen was evident in the next two games, both won by the Miami Marlins in their final at-bats.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Mets Avoid a No-Hitter and Stage a Late Rally, but That Isn’t Enough

2017-04-16.abstract: The rapper reflects on interior concerns on his “tart and punchy” fourth studio album, “DAMN.”
2017-04-16.snippet: The rapper reflects on interior concerns on his “tart and punchy” fourth studio album, “DAMN.”
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: Of all the characteristics that set Kendrick Lamar apart — his blazing verbal gifts, his determined cultural politics, his resolute aesthetic modesty — perhaps the most unusual, especially in this era of hyper-connectedness, has been his particular blend of assuredness and indifference. Excepting the occasional sidelong shot at a peer — one that’s fired down from the top of the mount, really — it often sounds as if he needed to hear only his own ticktock for guidance.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Review: Kendrick Lamar’s Anxiety Leads to Joy and Jabs on New Album

2017-04-16.abstract: The Times is changing how it shows where articles were written, hoping to more clearly convey that “we are on the scene around the world.”
2017-04-16.snippet: The Times is changing how it shows where articles were written, hoping to more clearly convey that “we are on the scene around the world.”
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: Datelines are the pride of The New York Times.

2017-04-16.abstract: Peter Gordon returns, and this time he’s not playing any tricks on us.
2017-04-16.snippet: Peter Gordon returns, and this time he’s not playing any tricks on us.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Peter Gordon is one of those “can pretty much do anything” constructors, but I think of him as a late week puzzle maker. Maybe that’s because he edits Fireball Crosswords, one of the toughest subscription crosswords around. Mr. Gordon has hit for the cycle, however, and he seems just as comfortable making an early-week puzzle as a brain-twisting Saturday.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Good Name

2017-04-16.abstract: Thousands of New Yorkers and tourists thronged Fifth Avenue in Manhattan from 47th to 57th Streets as church services let out around the city.
2017-04-16.snippet: Thousands of New Yorkers and tourists thronged Fifth Avenue in Manhattan from 47th to 57th Streets as church services let out around the city.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: It started out as a decadent promenade of the society set, strolling down Fifth Avenue in Manhattan each Easter Sunday, bonnet-topped and beautiful. And this Easter was no exception: in bejeweled sunglasses, bow ties and bunny ears, four shaggy dogs advanced down the street, some of them pushed in ribbon-strewn baby buggies tufted with spring buds.
2017-04-16.headline_main: On Easter, Chic in Everything but Black

2017-04-16.headline_main: To These Pastors, Saving the Colorado River Is a Divine Command

2017-04-16.abstract: Presidents often travel during first months in office and push a policy agenda. But without clear priorities, President Trump has stuck closer to home.
2017-04-16.snippet: Presidents often travel during first months in office and push a policy agenda. But without clear priorities, President Trump has stuck closer to home.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump has become a virtual homebody during his first few months in office, largely sitting out the honeymoon period that other presidents have used to hit the road and rally support for their priorities.
2017-04-16.headline_main: A Homebody President Sits Out His Honeymoon Period

2017-04-16.abstract: Throughout the countryside, once graceful buildings are being targeted for their antique architectural elements. A mayor is fighting to save them.
2017-04-16.snippet: Throughout the countryside, once graceful buildings are being targeted for their antique architectural elements. A mayor is fighting to save them.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: JOINVILLE, France — The soft-spoken mayor of this ancient village on the Marne River put his hand on my arm as we shivered in the late winter cold in front of a narrow house. Snow dusted the rooftops, and hardly a soul was in sight on the cobblestone street.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Stripped Village Homes Expose a Hollowing Out of France’s Heritage

2017-04-16.abstract: Jean-Luc Mélenchon’s advisers depict him as a kind of French Bernie Sanders, but with no strong party establishment to block his way.
2017-04-16.snippet: Jean-Luc Mélenchon’s advisers depict him as a kind of French Bernie Sanders, but with no strong party establishment to block his way.
2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: TOULOUSE, France — One man gives shivers to banks, businesspeople and the bourgeoisie. One man has been rising rapidly in polls, threatening the front-runners a week before the first round in France’s presidential election. One man has suddenly turned the French contest, locked for months between two favorites, into a four-man race.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Left-Wing Politician Shakes Up France’s Presidential Race

2017-04-16.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — After a six-month manhunt spanning at least three continents, the former governor of Veracruz state in Mexico was captured in Guatemala and will face extradition to Mexico, where he is wanted on suspicion of diverting millions of dollars to phantom companies, Mexican authorities said.
2017-04-16.headline_main: Javier Duarte, Mexican Ex-Governor Accused of Diverting Money, Is Captured

2017-04-17.abstract: Shannon Donnelly, a journalist who has chronicled Palm Beach society for decades, has been a fly on the gilded wall during several of President Trump’s visits since he took office.
2017-04-17.snippet: Shannon Donnelly, a journalist who has chronicled Palm Beach society for decades, has been a fly on the gilded wall during several of President Trump’s visits since he took office.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — Minutes before the world found out that President Trump had ordered a missile strike against Syria in retaliation for a chemical attack on civilians, the president took his usual stroll through the crowd of people eating dinner at Mar-a-Lago here. When he spotted Shannon Donnelly, a journalist who has chronicled Palm Beach society for decades, he approached her table, where she was seated with other guests.
2017-04-17.headline_main: The Society Columnist With a Front-Row Seat at Mar-a-Lago

2017-04-17.snippet: While Gary Sanchez and Greg Bird have faltered, the Yankees have stayed competitive by relying on players with eight or more seasons of experience.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: This is supposed to be the year of the youth movement at Yankee Stadium: actual young players in the lineup, budding stars on the farm, a long-overdue children’s play area at the park. The Class AAA team even sells an officially licensed “Baby Bombers” cap — for $35, you can support the Yankees’ long-term plan by wearing the logo of a snarling infant in a pinstriped diaper.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Yankees’ Prospects Hinge on Those Who Have Earned Their Stripes

2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: In America’s most storied political family, Rosemary Kennedy was the first in her generation to die of natural causes. Before then, a brother had been killed in war, a sister in a plane crash and two other brothers in assassinations.
2017-04-17.headline_main: The Quest for a Psychiatric Cure

2017-04-17.abstract: Watching Russian television and hearing journalists’ war stories, I wondered if I had arrived through an alt-right wormhole.
2017-04-17.snippet: Watching Russian television and hearing journalists’ war stories, I wondered if I had arrived through an alt-right wormhole.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — I wanted to better understand President Trump’s America, a place where truth is being ripped from its moorings as he brands those tasked with lashing it back into place — journalists — as dishonest enemies of the people.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A Lesson in Moscow About Trump-Style ‘Alternative Truth’

2017-04-17.abstract: President Trump’s national security adviser urged Pakistan to crack down on militants as the administration reviews its role in Afghanistan and the Taliban resurgence there.
2017-04-17.snippet: President Trump’s national security adviser urged Pakistan to crack down on militants as the administration reviews its role in Afghanistan and the Taliban resurgence there.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Talks between the United States and Afghanistan wrapped up here on Sunday, as the Trump administration reviews its options in the 15-year American presence in Afghanistan in the face of a resurgent Taliban.
2017-04-17.headline_main: After U.S. Talks With Afghanistan, Hints at a Harder Line on Pakistan

2017-04-17.abstract: As the standoff grows under a new American president, a mix of national ambitions, personal ego and deadly weapons is creating opportunities for miscalculation.
2017-04-17.snippet: As the standoff grows under a new American president, a mix of national ambitions, personal ego and deadly weapons is creating opportunities for miscalculation.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — All the elements of the North Korean nuclear crisis — the relentless drive by Kim Jong-un to assemble an arsenal, the propaganda and deception swirling around his progress, the hints of a covert war by the United States to undermine the effort, rather than be forced into open confrontation — were on vivid display this weekend.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A ‘Cuban Missile Crisis in Slow Motion’ in North Korea

2017-04-17.abstract: The final season jumps three years ahead, and things seem to have calmed.
2017-04-17.snippet: The final season jumps three years ahead, and things seem to have calmed.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: About halfway through the season premiere of “The Leftovers,” the perpetually anxious hero Kevin Garvey enjoys a moment of peace on his porch, surrounded by friends and family. When Season 2 ended, the Garveys’ adopted hometown, Jarden, Tex., had fallen into chaos, infiltrated by the doomsday cult Guilty Remnant and by armies of disgruntled nomads who had been gathering size for months outside the community’s gates. But when the Season 3 premiere begins (after two prologues I’ll address in a bit), everyone is settled into a congenial daily routine, three years after the events of last year’s finale. At a surprise party for his stepson, Tommy, Kevin has a relaxed evening of laughs, hugs and fellowship, during which he tells a sweet story about meeting Tommy’s mother, Laurie, when they were both involved in a car wreck. He muses on the whims of fate and the beauty of the universe, and on how so much of life is about being in the right place at the right time.
2017-04-17.headline_main: ‘The Leftovers’ Season 3 Premiere Recap: Revival

2017-04-17.abstract: The cast includes Jessie Mueller, Joshua Henry and Renée Fleming, while New York City Ballet’s Justin Peck will choreograph.
2017-04-17.snippet: The cast includes Jessie Mueller, Joshua Henry and Renée Fleming, while New York City Ballet’s Justin Peck will choreograph.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: “Carousel,” one of the greatest of American musicals, is returning to Broadway next season with an all-star cast that includes an opera diva and a creative team that includes a ballet world wunderkind.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A ‘Carousel’ Revival Promises Stars, Onstage and Off

2017-04-17.abstract: This uncanny play from the great experimentalist Richard Maxwell brings to mind Clint Eastwood’s Man With No Name, but with more to say.
2017-04-17.snippet: This uncanny play from the great experimentalist Richard Maxwell brings to mind Clint Eastwood’s Man With No Name, but with more to say.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Even the air aches with mystery in Richard Maxwell’s “Samara,” a sense of life as a teasing and unresolvable riddle. The sounds that saturate this hypnotic fable of a play, which opened on Sunday in a Soho Rep production, suggest the music that fills your mind when you’ve been encased in silence for too long – the sort of noises your imagination might conjure if you were lost for days in a desert.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Review: Lost and Found in a Steve Earle Soundscape in ‘Samara’

2017-04-17.abstract: Underlying figures back up the view that Chinese growth is humming along, but a government forecast suggests that economists expect slower growth later in the year.
2017-04-17.snippet: Underlying figures back up the view that Chinese growth is humming along, but a government forecast suggests that economists expect slower growth later in the year.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China’s economic data is usually very predictable. But occasionally there are surprises, though so small that by other countries’ standards they would barely be noticed.
2017-04-17.headline_main: China’s Economy Grows 6.9%, but Warning Signs Persist

2017-04-17.snippet: The Rangers trail in the first-round series, 2-1, and even drew boos from the Madison Square Garden crowd when they bumbled through a third-period power play.

Lundqvist explained succinctly how he isolated his emotions, especially amid intense playoff pressure.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Further Futility at Home Dooms Rangers Against Montreal

2017-04-17.abstract: Feeling surrounded by enemies, Joan decides to fight back the only way she knows how.
2017-04-17.snippet: Feeling surrounded by enemies, Joan decides to fight back the only way she knows how.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: In “Feud,” it is the individual moments that shimmer with possibility, depth and complexity. When considering the series as a whole, however, something essential dissipates. There’s a lecturing, feminism 101 tone to some of it, unnecessary to the story of two powerhouse women fighting to survive in a business that turned away from them. Neither woman fits into the neatly labeled containers the series has laid out for them. This is not a fatal flaw because the acting is so good, the individual moments so illuminating. These moments won’t be shaken off. They linger in the mind.
2017-04-17.headline_main: ‘Feud: Bette and Joan’ Episode 7 Recap: Feminism 101

2017-04-17.abstract: The creator of “Girls” talks about bringing her HBO show to a close with a very maternal episode.
2017-04-17.snippet: The creator of “Girls” talks about bringing her HBO show to a close with a very maternal episode.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The girls in HBO’s “Girls” have finally become women, kind of.

2017-04-17.snippet: This series wraps up with Lena Dunham’s Hannah feeding her infant, but the episode is about so much more than that.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The first image we ever see in “Girls” is Hannah Horvath being fed by her mother. Well, not literally. She’s slurping up pasta at a restaurant her parents have taken her to, to announce that they’re no longer going to support her financially.

2017-04-17.snippet: James Harden had 37 points and Patrick Beverley added 21 as Houston took the first game of their first-round playoff series against Oklahoma City.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — As he made his way to the Rockets’ bench late in the third quarter, Patrick Beverley paused just long enough to slap hands with another decent defender: J. J. Watt, the All-Pro defensive end for the N.F.L.’s Houston Texans. Watt, who was sitting courtside, appreciated what he was seeing during Sunday’s first-round playoff game, and he let Beverley know it.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Rockets Trounce the Thunder in Game 1

2017-04-17.abstract: On Wednesday evening, this landmark will display images from Harper’s Bazaar covers over the magazine’s 150 years.
2017-04-17.snippet: On Wednesday evening, this landmark will display images from Harper’s Bazaar covers over the magazine’s 150 years.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: On a typical New York night, you can see the Empire State Building lit up in color to honor a special occasion — green for Earth Day, for example, or red and blue for a Chicago Cubs World Series victory. But the building will look decidedly more extravagant on Wednesday, when Harper’s Bazaar will project 150 cover images — including of Audrey Hepburn, Reese Witherspoon and Gwyneth Paltrow — onto the building’s north facade to celebrate the magazine’s 150th anniversary.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A Fashion Show on the Empire State Building

2017-04-17.abstract: The Italian brand’s new pre-fall campaign features an all-black cast, but does it mark a real advance for fashion?
2017-04-17.snippet: The Italian brand’s new pre-fall campaign features an all-black cast, but does it mark a real advance for fashion?
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: In January, Gucci teased its 2017 pre-fall campaign with a series of Instagram videos in which it asked black models, “What does it mean to have soul?” It appeared that Gucci was making a statement on industry diversity, and the online response was, understandably, effusive — largely because of the industry’s long history of racial myopia. After all, while 2016 was, in many ways, fashion’s most inclusive year yet, some recent Gucci campaigns have been exclusively white.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Gucci’s Diversity Drag

2017-04-17.abstract: Adriana Rizzolo, a yoga teacher-healer-hair stylist, sees clients for “haircut and healing” sessions. Our columnist scheduled an appointment.
2017-04-17.snippet: Adriana Rizzolo, a yoga teacher-healer-hair stylist, sees clients for “haircut and healing” sessions. Our columnist scheduled an appointment.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The cliché goes, when you’re frustrated, you chop off your hair. I had the frustrated part down: Winter is cold and seemingly endless, politics are giving me nonstop anxiety, and I am pretty sure I’ve watched everything decent on television. All I needed was a trim, but I wanted something more.
2017-04-17.headline_main: This ‘Witch’ Casts Spells With Scissors and Sage

2017-04-17.headline_main: A Court Used for Playing Hoops Since 1893. Where? Paris.

2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: It was a jarringly unorthodox moment even for Donald Trump. At a rally in Colorado last October, an audience member handed him a gay pride flag that bore a handwritten endorsement: “LGBTs for TRUMP.” The candidate smiled as he unfurled the flag, displaying it for a few seconds. A spokesman later said Mr. Trump was “proud to carry the ‘L.G.B.T. for Trump’ rainbow flag on stage,” since he was campaigning to be “president for all Americans.”

Consumers routinely give Comcast, Charter (now Spectrum), Verizon, CenturyLink and AT&T basement-level scores for customer satisfaction. This collective resentment is fueled by the sense that we don’t have a choice when we sign up for their services.

2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: As a candidate, Donald Trump seemed to pay no more attention to North Korea’s accelerating nuclear weapons program, which his predecessor has warned is America’s most urgent threat, than he did to other complex foreign policy issues. His intemperate talk is adding to regional tensions, unnerving allies and likely reinforcing North Korea’s longstanding fear that it could one day be attacked by America — the very reason North Korea invested in a nuclear arsenal in the first place.

According to the publicist, the singer “was riding freight trains and that kind of stuff,” Mr. Russell, 87, said from his home in Forest Hills, Queens. “Had a hobo lifestyle.”

2017-04-17.abstract: Spoilers lie ahead.
2017-04-17.snippet: Spoilers lie ahead.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: She had been pregnant for much of the season, but in the series finale of “Girls” on HBO Sunday, titled “Latching,” we finally got a glimpse at how Hannah Horvath would handle motherhood. After a five-month time jump that skipped over her son Grover’s birth, the episode found Hannah and Marnie moving upstate to raise the baby as co-parents. If you’ve already watched it, read on for some of the best analyses of how Lena Dunham, Jenni Konner and Judd Apatow ended their perennially divisive series.
2017-04-17.headline_main: What You Should Read About the ‘Girls’ Series Finale

2017-04-17.snippet: The duo’s singles have performed well, and now its debut LP has opened at No. 1, bumping Drake’s “More Life” to No. 2.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: After three weeks, someone eventually had to bump Drake from No. 1 on the album chart, and that honor belongs to the D.J. duo the Chainsmokers — although they still couldn’t top Drake’s streaming numbers.
2017-04-17.headline_main: The Chainsmokers Prove They’re a Hit on the Album Chart, Too

2017-04-17.abstract: The water left from cooking chickpeas adds lift to these sweet confections.
2017-04-17.snippet: The water left from cooking chickpeas adds lift to these sweet confections.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The chef Diane Forley spent months perfecting meringues made from aquafaba, the liquid left from cooking chickpeas that is a vegan egg-white substitute. “It’s been a challenge, getting the proportions and the right kind of sugar to work,” said Ms. Forley, the owner of Flourish Baking Company in Scarsdale, N.Y. Finally satisfied with the results, Ms. Forley now sells a line of crisp, yet delicate kiss-shaped vegan meringues in flavors like chocolate, vanilla, maple, raspberry rose and orange blossom. She drizzles some with dark chocolate; others come in pretty boxes mixed with dried fruit and flowers. Keep them in mind for Mother’s Day: Meringues, $12 and up, boxed, 914-491-9205, meringueshop.com.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Vegan Meringues Made From Aquafaba

2017-04-17.abstract: C from Boardroom Spirits is an eau de vie distilled solely from carrots.
2017-04-17.snippet: C from Boardroom Spirits is an eau de vie distilled solely from carrots.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Eaux de vie are strong, unaged brandies usually made from fruit. But Boardroom Spirits, a craft distiller in Lansdale, Pa., also distills its from vegetables. It has produced a spirit from beets, and its latest is from carrots. It takes about 12½ pounds of fermented and distilled carrots for a 375-milliliter bottle. Nothing else is added. The bouquet and the flavor carry a musky whiff of sweet carrot. Drop a generous splash along with a few drops of orange bitters in a flute of prosecco, add a carrot-stick muddler, and you have a spring cocktail, or sip it after dinner, alongside some fresh goat cheese: Boardroom Spirits C, $30 for 375 milliliters, boardroomspirits.com.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Carrot Spirit Adds Verve to Spring Drinks

2017-04-17.abstract: On his first day on the Supreme Court, Justice Neil Gorsuch was an active questioner, displaying an easy familiarity with the issues in the cases before the court.
2017-04-17.snippet: On his first day on the Supreme Court, Justice Neil Gorsuch was an active questioner, displaying an easy familiarity with the issues in the cases before the court.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For the first time in more than a year, nine justices heard arguments at the Supreme Court on Monday. The new member of the court, Justice Neil M. Gorsuch, sat on the far right side of the bench, in the spot reserved for the most junior justice.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Bitter Fight Behind Him, Justice Gorsuch Starts Day With Relish

2017-04-17.abstract: Fearing losing their legitimacy, North Korea’s leaders created a permanent state of near-war, and an effective asymmetrical power dynamic.
2017-04-17.snippet: Fearing losing their legitimacy, North Korea’s leaders created a permanent state of near-war, and an effective asymmetrical power dynamic.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: North Korea, a small and poor country facing far stronger adversaries and the perpetual threat of its own collapse, would not seem a likely state to defy four consecutive American presidents.

2017-04-17.abstract: Turn the crank of this Japanese ice shaver for a pillowy mound of snow.
2017-04-17.snippet: Turn the crank of this Japanese ice shaver for a pillowy mound of snow.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: For shaved ice at home, nothing is more engagingly adorable — or effective — than this bright Japanese bear. Use ice cubes, turn the top crank, and a snowy mound of ice collects in a bowl below; drizzle syrup on top. Or you can freeze flavored water or fruit juice in the inner container, then let your bear at it. The eyes move as you grind: Bear Ice Shaver in blue, orange or yellow, $78 ($70.20 for members), MoMA Design Store, store.moma.org.
2017-04-17.headline_main: This Friendly Bear Is a Menace to Ice

2017-04-17.snippet: Kitchen Arts & Letters has opened a showroom of sorts in the Park South Hotel.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Matt Sartwell, the managing partner of Kitchen Arts & Letters, the culinary book store on the Upper East Side, has opened a branch in the lobby library of the Park South Hotel in NoMad. Along with culinary best sellers, how-to books, cookbooks from 28 Michelin-starred restaurants and foreign-language editions, there are also a number of rare and out-of-print volumes, including “Essential Cuisine” by Michel Bras. The books are there for browsing and can be ordered for purchase and shipping through the hotel concierge: Kitchen Arts & Letters, Park South Hotel, 124 East 28th Street, 212-448-0888, parksouthhotel.com.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Browse Cookbooks in the Lobby of a NoMad Hotel

2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: What if it really was Adam and Steve? That’s what the Out Front Theater Company in Atlanta, which stages shows exploring themes relevant to people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender or questioning, will set out to answer for audiences during a three-week run of “The Most Fabulous Story Ever Told,” starting April 27.

2017-04-17.snippet: These corn tortillas from Masienda are made from stone-ground heirloom corn.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Masienda, a tortilla brand that is preferred by many chefs, is now selling its heirloom corn tortillas online. These tortillas, made from stone-ground nixtamalized corn, are sold frozen. They may look drab, but the tortillas more than compensate with an earthy, naturally nutty corn flavor that blooms when they are heated. The website also sells dried corn and beans: Masienda Heirloom Corn Tortillas, $3 per package of 12, in lots of six or 12 packages and shipped on Mondays and Wednesdays, Masienda Bodega, masienda.com.

2017-04-17.abstract: Two flavors of torcetti, from the Piedmont region of Italy, are now available in New York.
2017-04-17.snippet: Two flavors of torcetti, from the Piedmont region of Italy, are now available in New York.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Torcetti are traditional cookies, but not overly sweet ones, from the Piedmont region of northern Italy. These crunchy rings of lightly sugared chocolate or plain pastry are named for their twisted shape. Said to date from the 1700s, they’re also known as biscotti piemontese. Serve them as you might biscotti, to dip into coffee, hot chocolate, grappa or sweet wine: Torcetti Biscotti Piemontese, eight ounces, $6.99 at Agata & Valentina, 1505 First Avenue (79th Street) and 64 University Place (10th Street), 212-452-0690.

2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: At the time of Prince’s death, his Paisley Park home and recording compound in Minnesota were strewn with “a sizable amount” of narcotic painkillers for which he did not have prescriptions, including some hidden in over-the-counter vitamin and aspirin bottles and others issued in the name of a close aide, according to newly released court documents related to the investigation into the accidental opioid overdose that killed Prince last year.

2017-04-17.abstract: Ovelia Transtoto gravitates toward pieces that are adjustable — so that people can customize their own styles.
2017-04-17.snippet: Ovelia Transtoto gravitates toward pieces that are adjustable — so that people can customize their own styles.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: To talk to Ovelia Transtoto about her year-old clothing brand isn’t to speak of fashion; in fact, the designer, 37, doesn’t find the f-word particularly useful. “I don’t know what ‘fashion’ is anymore — is it the industry itself? Is it trends?” she asks. “The definition is blurry. For me, creative expression takes the form of clothing — an object that someone can wear. You take two-dimensional fabric and turn it into a three-dimensional thing, and the number of stitches or the angle of the cuff can completely change the garment.”
2017-04-17.headline_main: Person to Know: The Designer Who Wants You to Transform Her Clothes

2017-04-17.abstract: Sajjid Mohmand, better known as Ehsanullah Ehsan, gained prominence through his ambitious media campaigns, savvy use of social media networks and frequent contact with journalists.
2017-04-17.snippet: Sajjid Mohmand, better known as Ehsanullah Ehsan, gained prominence through his ambitious media campaigns, savvy use of social media networks and frequent contact with journalists.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — The Pakistani military said Monday that a high-profile militant leader had surrendered, calling it a significant victory in efforts against the remnants of the Pakistani Taliban.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A Former Spokesman for the Pakistani Taliban Surrenders

2017-04-17.abstract: The Arconic board should have fired its chief executive, Klaus Kleinfeld, long ago. Under his watch, Alcoa and Arconic have underperformed their rivals.
2017-04-17.snippet: The Arconic board should have fired its chief executive, Klaus Kleinfeld, long ago. Under his watch, Alcoa and Arconic have underperformed their rivals.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Arconic’s board can at least thank Klaus Kleinfeld for a brief reprieve. Mr. Kleinfeld, the chairman and chief executive of Arconic, the Alcoa spinoff that makes specialty parts for cars and airplanes, stepped down on Monday for inappropriately writing a letter to an activist shareholder. That saves Arconic’s directors from having to fire him. But they will still have to answer for why they didn’t do that long ago.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Even Before Ill-Advised Letter, Arconic’s C.E.O. Had to Go

2017-04-17.abstract: Artists and music lovers converge in Indio, Calif., for Coachella, showing off their festival best.
2017-04-17.snippet: Artists and music lovers converge in Indio, Calif., for Coachella, showing off their festival best.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Artists and music lovers converge in Indio, Calif., for Coachella, showing off their festival best.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Street Style: Coachella

2017-04-17.abstract: San Francisco’s Young Adult Court, created in 2015, is based on recent research suggesting that brain development extends beyond age 18, into the 20s.
2017-04-17.snippet: San Francisco’s Young Adult Court, created in 2015, is based on recent research suggesting that brain development extends beyond age 18, into the 20s.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On a cloudy afternoon in the Bayview district, Shaquille, 21, was riding in his sister’s 1991 Acura when another car ran a stop sign, narrowly missing them.
2017-04-17.headline_main: A California Court for Young Adults Calls on Science

2017-04-17.abstract: Chris Wells’s chatty, memoirish show at Dixon Place combines outrageous fashion and original songs.
2017-04-17.snippet: Chris Wells’s chatty, memoirish show at Dixon Place combines outrageous fashion and original songs.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: If the New York metropolitan area reports a critical cape shortage, blame Chris Wells. Mr. Wells is a writer, an actor and a high priest of the monthly artist be-in Secret City. Possibly, he has met a mantle or a poncho he didn’t long to swirl around his shoulders; it seems unlikely. In “It Will All Work Out,” a wobbly, bighearted, cloak-and-chatter show at Dixon Place, Mr. Wells narrates tales from his life while modeling a series of whirling, spangled outfits.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Review: ‘It Will All Work Out’ Banishes Worry With Razzle-Dazzle

2017-04-17.abstract: It takes nerve to follow up on Ibsen. But “A Doll’s House, Part 2” is hardly the first Broadway show to check in with beloved characters.
2017-04-17.snippet: It takes nerve to follow up on Ibsen. But “A Doll’s House, Part 2” is hardly the first Broadway show to check in with beloved characters.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Henrik Ibsen’s Nora walks back through the door she famously slammed all those years ago, and we have so many questions. Where has she been, and what has she been up to? She’s looking rather well, actually, decked out in expensive clothes. But how did she get the money? And for goodness’ sake, why has she returned?
2017-04-17.headline_main: Then What Happened? The Checkered History of Stage Sequels

2017-04-17.abstract: On Wednesday, TV and movie writers will begin voting on whether to authorize a walkout, which could occur on May 2. Health care is a major issue.
2017-04-17.snippet: On Wednesday, TV and movie writers will begin voting on whether to authorize a walkout, which could occur on May 2. Health care is a major issue.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The threat of a Hollywood strike is getting real.
2017-04-17.headline_main: With a Hollywood Writers’ Strike Looming, Here’s What to Know

2017-04-17.abstract: The percentage of scientists aged 55 and older nearly doubled from 1993 to 2008, amid concerns that young researchers are getting crowded out.
2017-04-17.snippet: The percentage of scientists aged 55 and older nearly doubled from 1993 to 2008, amid concerns that young researchers are getting crowded out.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The work force is aging in the United States, and scientists are leading the way. From 1993 to 2008, the share of scientists aged 55 and older increased by nearly 90 percent, according to David Blau and Bruce Weinberg, economics professors at the Ohio State University.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Ranks of Scientists Aging Faster Than Other Workers

2017-04-17.abstract: A Times reporter and her colleagues attended an Easter service in one of the Christian towns near Mosul that has been hit hardest by the Islamic State.
2017-04-17.snippet: A Times reporter and her colleagues attended an Easter service in one of the Christian towns near Mosul that has been hit hardest by the Islamic State.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants overran the Christian town of Qaraqosh nearly three years ago, smashing every crucifix they found and using the walls of churches for target practice. Residents fled by the thousands, and the few who stayed were forced to spit on images of the Virgin Mary.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Celebrating Easter in an Iraqi Town That Has Lost Its Christians

2017-04-17.abstract: Moscow and its state-run news outlets are churning out fake and slanted reports to bolster favored politicians, just as in the U.S. last year, critics say.
2017-04-17.snippet: Moscow and its state-run news outlets are churning out fake and slanted reports to bolster favored politicians, just as in the U.S. last year, critics say.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The flagging, scandal-plagued presidential campaign of François Fillon — a former prime minister of France much liked by the Kremlin but not so much, it seems, by French voters — received a surprise lift late last month with a report that he had staged a remarkable recovery in opinion polls and was now leading the pack ahead of voting this Sunday.
2017-04-17.headline_main: It’s France’s Turn to Worry About Election Meddling by Russia

2017-04-17.abstract: State and federal rulings put another roadblock in front of the state’s plan to carry out a series of lethal injections before its execution drugs expire.
2017-04-17.snippet: State and federal rulings put another roadblock in front of the state’s plan to carry out a series of lethal injections before its execution drugs expire.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: VARNER, Ark. — After a pair of court defeats, the state of Arkansas was forced late Monday to abandon its plan to carry out its first execution in more than a decade. The canceled execution of a condemned prisoner here was a significant setback for the state, which had sought to put eight men to death this month, before its stock of a lethal injection drug expired.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Court Decisions Force Arkansas to Halt Execution

2017-04-17.abstract: On Saturday scientists and their advocates are expected to fill streets in more than 500 cities. But what they do next is just as important.
2017-04-17.snippet: On Saturday scientists and their advocates are expected to fill streets in more than 500 cities. But what they do next is just as important.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Scientists and science advocates are expected to fill the streets of more than 500 cities across the world on Saturday in support of scientific research, which they feel has increasingly come under attack, especially during the Trump administration.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Scientists and Activists Look Beyond the March for Science

2017-04-17.abstract: In remarks submitted to The Times, some said the president’s posture toward science demanded a response, but others worried about the politicization of science.
2017-04-17.snippet: In remarks submitted to The Times, some said the president’s posture toward science demanded a response, but others worried about the politicization of science.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: The March for Science on April 22 may or may not accomplish the goals set out by its organizers. But it has required many people who work in a variety of scientific fields — as well as Americans who are passionate about science — to grapple with the proper role of science in our civic life.
2017-04-17.headline_main: The March for Science: Why Some Are Going, and Some Will Sit Out

2017-04-17.abstract: A move to block hateful speech on the site has punished comedians, political commentators and experts on everything from military arms to video games.
2017-04-17.snippet: A move to block hateful speech on the site has punished comedians, political commentators and experts on everything from military arms to video games.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: At the age of 21, David Pakman started a little Massachusetts community radio talk program. While the young broadcaster got his show syndicated on a few public radio stations, it was a YouTube channel he began in 2009, “The David Pakman Show,” that opened up his progressive political commentary to a whole new digital audience. The show has since amassed 353,000 subscribers, and roughly half of its revenue now comes from the ads that play before his videos. He earns enough to produce the show full time and pay a lean staff.
2017-04-17.headline_main: How YouTube’s Shifting Algorithms Hurt Independent Media

2017-04-17.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-04-17.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-04-17.headline_main: Mike Pence, Turkey, Facebook: Your Monday Evening Briefing

2017-04-17.abstract: A&E, Showtime and the Smithsonian Channel reflect on the moment in 1992 when the Rodney King verdict set off a wave of violence.
2017-04-17.snippet: A&E, Showtime and the Smithsonian Channel reflect on the moment in 1992 when the Rodney King verdict set off a wave of violence.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: If any anniversary should still resonate today, it’s the one surrounding the verdicts in the beating of Rodney G. King 25 years ago this month and the events that followed. Three television specials in the next few days revisit that dismaying moment in American history, but all seem reluctant to spend much time exploring the connections between 1992 and more recent headline-making events in various cities that have left black residents dead. Maybe the producers felt they’d be stating the obvious; maybe they were just seduced by the fascinating but oft-told tales from 1992. Either way, it leaves the specials feeling incomplete.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Review: 3 Anniversary Programs Look at Los Angeles in Flames

2017-04-17.abstract: In the United States and Canada, nearly one-fifth of homeless youth are victims of human trafficking.
2017-04-17.snippet: In the United States and Canada, nearly one-fifth of homeless youth are victims of human trafficking.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: For decades, one set of activists and legislators have fought to end human trafficking, while a different set have worked tirelessly to try to end homelessness. Activists and legislators have rarely teamed up to fight the two issues simultaneously.
2017-04-17.headline_main: Homeless Youth at High Risk of Human Trafficking

2017-04-17.abstract: Ms. Weilerstein, set to perform all six of Bach’s solo cello suites in a single concert on Saturday, chooses her favorite page of the score.
2017-04-17.snippet: Ms. Weilerstein, set to perform all six of Bach’s solo cello suites in a single concert on Saturday, chooses her favorite page of the score.
2017-04-17.lead_paragraph: Think of a cellist performing all six of Bach’s solo cello suites in a single concert as akin to a mountaineer’s climbing Everest: In itself, it has become a regular thing, but the achievement, not to mention the courage it requires, still has a special status.
2017-04-17.headline_main: ‘It Demands Everything of You’: Alisa Weilerstein on Bach

2017-04-17.abstract: Here is what happens when people fly more often, in fuller planes and pay higher fees.

2017-04-18.abstract: After three losses to the Marlins in which Mets relievers collapsed in the late innings, there was some good news: Jeurys Familia was set to return after serving a suspension.
2017-04-18.snippet: After three losses to the Marlins in which Mets relievers collapsed in the late innings, there was some good news: Jeurys Familia was set to return after serving a suspension.
2017-04-18.lead_paragraph: The Mets’ three straight losses to the Miami Marlins over the weekend occurred under different circumstances but had one common theme: The Mets’ bullpen — both its top relievers and its lesser ones — stumbled in the final innings.
2017-04-18.headline_main: Mets’ Bullpen Has Floundered, but Help Is on the Way

2017-04-18.abstract: On the sidelines of the sailing race off Bermuda, one team and its partners are backing tests of a new way to capture a destructive nonnative species.
2017-04-18.snippet: On the sidelines of the sailing race off Bermuda, one team and its partners are backing tests of a new way to capture a destructive nonnative species.
2017-04-18.lead_paragraph: The America’s Cup is a technology race as much as a sailboat race. Make a breakthrough in design — be it a winged keel or, in this era of hydrofoiling, a better daggerboard — and your chances of securing the oldest major trophy in sports increase considerably.
2017-04-18.headline_main: In America’s Cup Waters, a Robot Takes On an Invasion of Lionfish

2017-04-18.abstract: A political reporter reflects on seeing different sides of the New Jersey governor as he faced the aftermath of a scandal and ran for president.
2017-04-18.snippet: A political reporter reflects on seeing different sides of the New Jersey governor as he faced the aftermath of a scandal and ran for president.
2017-04-18.lead_paragraph: The notoriously moody governor was in high spirits. He had just come from playing co-host on his good friend’s sports radio talk show — “Boomer and Carton.” The Rangers were about to enter the playoffs. The Mets were on the cusp of a promising season and had yet to blow it in their typical excruciating fashion. And he had just earned his first official title with the Trump administration: chairman of the president’s drug addiction task force.
2017-04-18.headline_main: The (Other) Other Side of Chris Christie

2017-04-18.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, April 18, 2017.
2017-04-18.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, April 18, 2017.
