2017-04-23.snippet: The 20-year-old Atlanta artist came to New York for a trip that demonstrated how quickly the internet can change a rapper’s life.
2017-04-23.lead_paragraph: SahBabii’s “Pull Up Wit Ah Stick,” one of the best hip-hop songs of the past year, is a study in contrasts, full of tough talk delivered in a sweet, lithe, almost naïve voice. The song’s video, filmed in Atlanta’s tough ninth ward, teems with guns and children. When he opens his mouth to rap, you can see his braces.
2017-04-23.headline_main: Rising Rapper SahBabii Packages Tough Talk in a Sweet Voice

2017-04-23.abstract: An impressive cast at the Juilliard School, performing an English translation of Janacek’s “Katya Kabanova,” brings special intensity to a rustic tragedy.
2017-04-23.snippet: An impressive cast at the Juilliard School, performing an English translation of Janacek’s “Katya Kabanova,” brings special intensity to a rustic tragedy.
2017-04-23.lead_paragraph: In a crucial early scene of Janacek’s “Katya Kabanova,” the title character, a young woman trapped in a stultifying marriage to a timid merchant in a town on the Volga, recalls memories of her carefree childhood. As a girl, Katya tells Varvara, her adopted sister-in-law, she would rise early on summer days, wash in the stream and tend to every flower in her house. Going to church was like falling into a trance, Katya says; she imagined rising to heaven to watch angels fly.
2017-04-23.headline_main: Review: Gifted Singers and an English Translation Enhance a Janacek Opera

2017-04-23.abstract: How one reader came under the spell of Walcott’s poetry. And a suggested starter kit to his poems.
2017-04-23.snippet: How one reader came under the spell of Walcott’s poetry. And a suggested starter kit to his poems.
2017-04-23.lead_paragraph: I found Derek Walcott’s “Omeros” in the stacks of the Montclair Book Center in New Jersey: a frail blue paperback with a seahorse on the cover and the previous owner’s phone number across the flyleaf’s edge. It was literary flotsam, a poem I hadn’t heard of and couldn’t place in time or tradition. Here were the names of Homer — Hector, Helen, Philoctete, Achille — but also Voodoo deities and lines from “Buffalo Soldier,” ghosts of Troy but also camera-wielding tourists and fishermen revving chain saws as they prepared to fell the ancient trees (those last silent “gods” of a pre-Columbian past) on a forested volcanic slope. The stanzas moved to Dante’s terza rima, but the poem began in patois: “This is how, one sunrise, we cut down them canoes.”
2017-04-23.headline_main: In Praise of Derek Walcott’s Epic of the Americas

2017-04-23.abstract: For the first time in nearly two decades, Bill O’Reilly will not be kicking off Fox News’s prime-time lineup. The other cable networks have noticed.

But in political terms, for a mayor seeking re-election as a progressive defined by his defiance of President Trump, the swipe from the federal government was more like a gift.

2017-04-24.abstract: A centrist novice is likely to defeat the right-wing candidate. Yet France will remain divided.
2017-04-24.snippet: A centrist novice is likely to defeat the right-wing candidate. Yet France will remain divided.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Defenders of liberal democracy in France and elsewhere sighed with relief after Sunday’s first-round vote in France’s presidential election. The centrist, pro-European Union political upstart, Emmanuel Macron, who founded his En Marche! party just last year, looks set to face off against the far-right populist National Front candidate, Marine Le Pen, in the final vote for the French presidency on May 7. Polls have predicted that Mr. Macron will beat Ms. Le Pen handily, though, with its traditional parties left in shambles by this election, France remains deeply divided and its politics unsteady.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Emmanuel Macron Mounts a Patriot’s Challenge to Marine Le Pen

2017-04-24.abstract: Cavaliers sweep the Pacers, again, thanks to the return of the game’s most dangerous player: Playoff LeBron.
2017-04-24.snippet: Cavaliers sweep the Pacers, again, thanks to the return of the game’s most dangerous player: Playoff LeBron.

Smith and extending to the rim for a layup. It seemed simple enough. But Young, the starting power forward for the Indiana Pacers, forgot. He forgot about the best player in the world.
2017-04-24.headline_main: LeBron James Issues a Timely Reminder of His Greatness

2017-04-24.abstract: For all its melancholy, “The Leftovers” rarely gets enough credit for its humor.
2017-04-24.snippet: For all its melancholy, “The Leftovers” rarely gets enough credit for its humor.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Through its first two seasons, “The Leftovers” has set itself apart from the prestige drama pack by constructing episodes that largely avoid the “here’s what all the characters are up to this week” model, and instead tell complete stories, with their own complex and individual narratives. The set-up-heavy season three premiere was an exception, as episodes toward the beginnings and ends of seasons tend to be. But this week’s episode, “Don’t Be Ridiculous,” is classic “Leftovers,” focusing almost entirely on Nora Durst as she gets an unexpected phone call that for a few days turns her life upside-down.
2017-04-24.headline_main: ‘The Leftovers’ Season 3, Episode 2: Swedish Physicists

2017-04-24.abstract: In this endlessly fascinating work, Annie Baker, the author of “The Flick,” considers the art and necessity of fabulation.
2017-04-24.snippet: In this endlessly fascinating work, Annie Baker, the author of “The Flick,” considers the art and necessity of fabulation.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Just exactly how many kinds of stories are there, anyway? The tallies vary in “The Antipodes,” Annie Baker’s in-all-ways fabulous new play about professional fabulators in pursuit of the ultimate yarn.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Review: ‘The Antipodes’ and Ambiguous Brainstorming

2017-04-24.abstract: Christian Borle is the eccentric Willy Wonka in this tentative musical based on the Roald Dahl children’s classic.
2017-04-24.snippet: Christian Borle is the eccentric Willy Wonka in this tentative musical based on the Roald Dahl children’s classic.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Don’t expect a sugar rush from “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory,” the new musical that opened at the Lunt-Fontanne Theater on Sunday. This latest adaptation of Roald Dahl’s winningly sinister children’s story from 1964 is — thank heaven — no sweeter than the two film adaptations it inspired, starring Gene Wilder (1971) and Johnny Depp (2005).
2017-04-24.headline_main: Review: Some Sugar but Not Enough Spice in This ‘Chocolate Factory’

2017-04-24.abstract: Contrary to some assumptions, Taylor may turn out to be Axe’s truest protégé and disciple.
2017-04-24.snippet: Contrary to some assumptions, Taylor may turn out to be Axe’s truest protégé and disciple.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Sunday night’s episode of “Billions” makes repeated references to the film version of John Grisham’s novel “The Firm,” specifically the relationship between Mitch McDeere (Tom Cruise), a young lawyer at a sinister Memphis law firm, and Wayne Tarrance (Ed Harris), the F.B.I. agent determined to breach the firm’s imposing firewall. In the Wayne Tarrance role, Connerty believes that he’s found his Tom Cruise in Taylor, who’s new to Axe Capital and whose profile as a gender-nonconforming, almond-latte-drinking iconoclast suggests an ideal candidate for flipping. After all, Taylor, similar to Mitch McDeere, hasn’t been part of Axe’s corporate culture for long and thus doesn’t have the loyalties (or blackmail threats) that keep more veteran employees bound to the company.
2017-04-24.headline_main: ‘Billions’ Season 2, Episode 10: Nonconformity

2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: “Feud” jumps ahead to the 1970s for the season finale, in an episode titled “You Mean All This Time We Could Have Been Friends?” — a reference to one of Bette Davis’s lines in the final scene of “What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?” It was a bleak era for Davis and Joan Crawford, both of them rattling around in an abyss of free time. If you’ve been a workaholic your whole life, you can’t enjoy retirement. What are you supposed to do with yourself?
2017-04-24.headline_main: ‘Feud: Bette and Joan’ Season Finale: Two Seconds

2017-04-24.abstract: The vision of the good guy gunning down the bad guy is driving the modern gun rights debate.
2017-04-24.snippet: The vision of the good guy gunning down the bad guy is driving the modern gun rights debate.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: FAIRFAX, Va. — A poster figure of John Wayne, the mega-hero of Hollywood westerns, offers a greeting here at the gun museum’s gallery door as he holds his Winchester carbine at the ready and offers an amiably crooked grin. The bad guys in the movies never fully understood that the menace behind Wayne’s grin (“Whoa, take ‘er easy there, Pilgrim”) meant he was about to deliver blazing fantasies of triumphant gunfire that would leave them dead in the dust. It’s no wonder modern Florida legislators could not resist protecting actual shooters who draw and fire like John Wayne as guilt-free, “stand-your-ground” defenders.
2017-04-24.headline_main: The N.R.A. Says, Go Ahead, Make My Fantasy

2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, in an instant, everything changed for my family and me. While my husband, Dave, and I were on vacation, he died suddenly from a cardiac arrhythmia.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Sheryl Sandberg: How to Build Resilient Kids, Even After a Loss

2017-04-24.abstract: They can take out terrorists and train armies. But they can’t win wars.
2017-04-24.snippet: They can take out terrorists and train armies. But they can’t win wars.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: As the North Korean Army slashed its way down the Korean Peninsula in 1950, 15-man units inflitrated South Korean lines to ambush convoys and demolish bridges. America sought to respond in kind, forming Ranger units with skills like low-altitude parachuting and sabotage. Americans fell in love with these elite warriors. One reporter wrote that each Ranger “is a one-man gang who can sneak up to an enemy sentry, chop off his head, and catch it before it makes noise by hitting the ground.”
2017-04-24.headline_main: America’s Dangerous Love for Special Ops

At least three turned up dead. Some people reported being tortured.

2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: My mother was what we would now call math anxious, if not phobic. My daughter, on the other hand, was a math major, which always left me feeling like the transitional generation, capable of mastering standardized-test math problems and surviving college calculus (it’s one of the pre-med requirements) but never really connecting to the beauty or power of the subject.

2017-04-24.snippet: How a refugee from Bolshevik Russia became the ultimate apostle of American anti-Communism.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: STANFORD, Calif. — The crowds jostling below, the soldiers marching down icy boulevards, the roar of a people possessed: All this a young Ayn Rand witnessed from her family’s apartment, perched high above the madness near Nevsky Prospekt, a central thoroughfare of Petrograd, the Russian city formerly known as St. Petersburg.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Ayn Rand’s Counter-Revolution

2017-04-24.snippet: Hospital data suggests that some immigrants from Africa and the Caribbean, thinking they are still immune, do not take precautions on home visits.

2017-04-24.abstract: Letters and diaries from a young Welles, along with unpublished scripts, have been acquired by the University of Michigan.
2017-04-24.snippet: Letters and diaries from a young Welles, along with unpublished scripts, have been acquired by the University of Michigan.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Letters, postcards, diaries and doodles from a teenage Orson Welles, along with unpublished scripts of his many incomplete projects from the ’50s and ’60s, have been acquired by the University of Michigan. The items, which came from his youngest daughter, Beatrice Welles, add to the already extensive trove of Welles memorabilia that the university holds as part of its Screen Arts Mavericks & Makers collection.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Orson Welles’s Diaries and Scripts Head to Archive

2017-04-24.abstract: VinoGo, a wineskin for modern times, holds a standard 750-milliliter bottle.
2017-04-24.snippet: VinoGo, a wineskin for modern times, holds a standard 750-milliliter bottle.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: To lighten the picnic basket or to feel secure about carrying wine on a boat, decant your bottle into this new plastic sleeve that holds 750 milliliters. It stays standing as you fill it (slowly), doesn’t leak and can be rinsed out and reused. Just take care not to squeeze it as it fills, or some of the wine may splash out the top: VinoGo, Cork Pops, $7, 800-322-6757, corkpops.com.
2017-04-24.headline_main: A Reusable Pouch for Wine on the Go

2017-04-24.abstract: Food52 now sells professional nonstick pans from the Italian manufacturer Ballarini.
2017-04-24.snippet: Food52 now sells professional nonstick pans from the Italian manufacturer Ballarini.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: These no-nonsense Ballarini professional skillets, available from Italy for the first time, are worth adding to the kitchen arsenal. They are heavy yet well balanced, so flipping a pile of sizzling sugar snaps is easy. The pans are made of thick, cold-forged aluminum for good conductivity. The interiors are coated in a nonstick ceramic that is safe to use with metal utensils. They can go into an oven up to 500 degrees, and the metal handles stay fairly cool: Ballarini skillets, $36 to $60, food52.com.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Economical Aluminum Skillets With Heft

2017-04-24.abstract: A new workplace sitcom, with Tina Fey as an executive producer, stars Andrea Martin and Briga Heelan as a mother and daughter in TV news. Mom’s the intern.
2017-04-24.snippet: A new workplace sitcom, with Tina Fey as an executive producer, stars Andrea Martin and Briga Heelan as a mother and daughter in TV news. Mom’s the intern.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Tina Fey’s name is on the NBC workplace comedy “Great News,” and the workplace in question is a television studio, but adjust your expectations downward if you want to enjoy this silly series. It’s not “30 Rock II.” But it is a terrific showcase for Andrea Martin, still funny after all these years.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Review: ‘Great News,’ Served Up by a Dysfunctional Crew

2017-04-24.abstract: Pop-up alerts that constantly pester you about fixing your system drivers for a fee want money for something you can do yourself free.
2017-04-24.snippet: Pop-up alerts that constantly pester you about fixing your system drivers for a fee want money for something you can do yourself free.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Q. I keep getting a window popping up on my laptop running Windows 10 that says I have outdated drivers, with an offer to update them for a price. 2017-04-24.abstract: Murray’s Cheese is importing a dozen cheeses from small organic producers in Denmark.
2017-04-24.snippet: Murray’s Cheese is importing a dozen cheeses from small organic producers in Denmark.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Murray’s Cheese has added a collection of artisanal Danish cheeses to the usual Havarti and Tilsit. Steve Millard, the senior vice president for merchandising, found some organic cheeses on a trip to Denmark last summer, and the company is now importing a dozen. Among the standouts are the saline, spreadable Danish White Cheese; Vita Mundo, a light goat cheese; the fruity and creamy Flora Mundo; Vesterhavsost, a complex semisoft cheese from northern Denmark with a hint of seaside brininess; and Trelleborg, a nutty cow’s milk cheese with rich caramel notes balanced by good acidity. Some cheeses are $8.99 each; others are $24.99 a pound: Murray’s Cheese, 254 Bleecker Street, murrayscheese.com.
2017-04-24.headline_main: New Danish Cheeses Make Their American Debut

2017-04-24.abstract: At Du’s Donuts in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Wylie Dufresne specializes in cake doughnuts.
2017-04-24.snippet: At Du’s Donuts in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Wylie Dufresne specializes in cake doughnuts.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: At Du’s Donuts and Coffee, the chef Wylie Dufresne is frying doughnuts along with the baker Colin Kull, an alumnus of Tartine in San Francisco. Their tender, modest-size cake doughnuts have inventive, Instagram-ready glazes or a dusting of sugar. “Having a doughnut shop was my dream for many years,” said Mr. Dufresne, who has exited the restaurant business for now. “I grew up in New England, cake-doughnut country, and my grandfather was a doughnut baker.” Nonetheless, you would be hard-pressed to find coffee-malt, pomegranate-tahini, Mexican hot chocolate or bright pink strawberries-and-cream doughnuts in the Berkshires. The airy shop and cafe, opening Wednesday, also dispenses Brooklyn Roasting Company coffee: Du’s Donuts and Coffee, William Vale Hotel, 107 North 12th Street (Wythe Avenue), Williamsburg, Brooklyn, dusdonuts.com.
2017-04-24.headline_main: A Creative Chef Sets His Sights on Doughnuts

2017-04-24.snippet: An unlikely new reference guide breaks down U.F.O. sightings county by county, shape by shape, month by month.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: SYRACUSE — Why have sightings of unidentified flying objects around the nation more than tripled since 2001? Why is July the busiest month for U.F.O. sightings? Why did they spike in Texas in 2008, or in New Mexico in September 2015?

2017-04-24.abstract: ‘Chiltern Firehouse’ explains how André Balazs transformed a rundown building into a successful hotel and restaurant.
2017-04-24.snippet: ‘Chiltern Firehouse’ explains how André Balazs transformed a rundown building into a successful hotel and restaurant.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: A cookbook is no substitute for a coveted reservation. But for fans of the Chiltern Firehouse in London, or those who dream of its Caesar salad with chicken skin, a lavish new cookbook may serve as the next best thing. The hotelier André Balazs transformed a rundown fire station into a hotel and restaurant, and put the pedestrian Marylebone district on the social map. In the book, the chef Nuno Mendes offers a seamless blend of English, French and American specialties. Many of his recipes are complex, but some worthwhile tips include how to cure fish, make brown-butter mayonnaise and slow-roast poussin. Drink recipes are presented two ways: for home bars and in large-batch, sous-vide professional versions: “Chiltern Firehouse: The Cookbook” by Nuno Mendes and André Balazs (Ten Speed Press, $50).
2017-04-24.headline_main: Cookbook Offers a Taste of London’s Famed Firehouse

2017-04-24.snippet: Pat LaFrieda’s new burger blend adds Urbani truffles to the mix.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Fragrant summer truffles give a subtle touch of umami to the butcher Pat LaFrieda’s new burger. A blend of short rib, chuck and brisket, this burger contains minced Italian truffles from Urbani. A few restaurants have started serving them, including Bowery Meat Company; Burger & Barrel Wine Pub, where the burger is draped with melted Robiola cheese; and Porter House Bar and Grill, where it’s topped with braised short rib, Fontina cheese, onion jam and more truffles. Now, home cooks can find the fresh burgers on Mr. LaFrieda’s website and at Eataly stores (starting Tuesday): Truffle Burgers, four 6-ounce burgers, $28.90 (minimum two packages), lafrieda.com; $12.80 a pound at Eataly.

2017-04-24.abstract: In “Gone,” the violinist Min Kym writes about dealing with expectations as a child prodigy, and about the theft of her rare Stradivarius.
2017-04-24.snippet: In “Gone,” the violinist Min Kym writes about dealing with expectations as a child prodigy, and about the theft of her rare Stradivarius.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: “I knew right away that holding a violin, playing a violin, was not simply for me, but it was me.” That’s how Min Kym describes one of her first music lessons as a child, in “Gone: A Girl, a Violin, a Life Unstrung.” Kym’s memoir details the shock waves that followed after her rare 1696 Stradivarius was stolen from a London cafe. The theft sent Kym reeling, an experience she describes in the book, as she also delves into what it meant to be a prodigy raised by a traditional Korean family living in London. Below, she tells us about how the book changed as she wrote it, the most surprising thing she learned while finishing it, and more.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Prodigy Loses Her ‘Soul Mate’ — a Rare Violin

2017-04-24.abstract: A court case involving one of the most high profile scandals in Broadway history began on Monday.

2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Opening arguments began on Monday in a civil trial about a Broadway musical that never came to be, a real-life drama that, even by showbiz standards, stretched the suspension of disbelief.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Trial for Broadway’s ‘Rebecca’ Scandal Begins

2017-04-24.abstract: For those who like their mysteries snowy, sunny or operatically violent, new seasons have begun.
2017-04-24.snippet: For those who like their mysteries snowy, sunny or operatically violent, new seasons have begun.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Remember when you could still complain that there was nothing on television but crime shows? You know, the bad old days of the 2000s. While the TV renaissance has radically changed the mix — hello, superheroes, political soaps, brittle sitcoms — the crime drama hasn’t gone away. And the rising tide has meant that it’s often more interesting than it used to be, and present in greater variety.
2017-04-24.headline_main: ‘Fortitude,’ ‘Bosch,’ ‘Gomorrah’: TV Crime Never Sleeps

2017-04-24.abstract: The sex columnist Dan Savage and others take on the relationship dynamics in “The Flying Dutchman,” at the Metropolitan Opera through May 12.
2017-04-24.snippet: The sex columnist Dan Savage and others take on the relationship dynamics in “The Flying Dutchman,” at the Metropolitan Opera through May 12.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: “It’s a common delusion, particularly among women, that their love is transformative,” Dan Savage, the sex columnist and host of the podcast “Savage Love,” said in a recent interview. “That they can find their damaged man and, by loving him, they can save him, restore him, fix him, make him a better person.”
2017-04-24.headline_main: Operatic Codependency? We Put Wagner on the Couch

2017-04-24.abstract: The Kremlin denied the allegations that Russian hackers breached email accounts at Denmark’s Defense Ministry and Foreign Ministry in 2015 and 2016.

2017-04-24.abstract: The director of “Bandstand” had to introduce changes — then let go.
2017-04-24.snippet: The director of “Bandstand” had to introduce changes — then let go.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: In theater parlance, a show is “frozen” when — on a designated rehearsal day, usually about a week before opening night — no more fixes, cuts or additions are introduced. While not contractually mandated, it’s a decision and a deadline, determined by the director and the creative team, that give the cast a sense of an ending. Up to that point, the actors rehearse by day and adjust their performances for an audience that night.
2017-04-24.headline_main: With Clock Ticking, a New Musical Makes Its Final Fixes

2017-04-24.abstract: The Financial Choice Act 2.0 could make life easier for Wall Street defendants accused of wrongdoing, or at the least slow the enforcement process down.

2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: The draft of the Financial Choice Act 2.0, released last week by the House Financial Services Committee and aimed at overturning much of the Dodd-Frank Act, contains provisions that could change how the Securities and Exchange Commission polices the markets.

2017-04-24.abstract: Behind the Trump administration’s sudden urgency on North Korea lies a stark calculus: that the country is capable of making a nuclear bomb every six or seven weeks.
2017-04-24.snippet: Behind the Trump administration’s sudden urgency on North Korea lies a stark calculus: that the country is capable of making a nuclear bomb every six or seven weeks.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Behind the Trump administration’s sudden urgency in dealing with the North Korean nuclear crisis lies a stark calculus: a growing body of expert studies and classified intelligence reports that conclude the country is capable of producing a nuclear bomb every six or seven weeks.

2017-04-24.abstract: Some players help their teams by being major irritants. Bloody or illegal hits can be part of the package.
2017-04-24.snippet: Some players help their teams by being major irritants. Bloody or illegal hits can be part of the package.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: Late in the second period of a scoreless Game 3 of his first-round playoff series at Madison Square Garden, Montreal Canadiens forward Steve Ott went to work. With Rangers forward Mats Zuccarello hovering around Montreal goaltender Carey Price, Ott stepped in front of Zuccarello and without warning began tousling his long locks.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Distracting or Dirty, N.H.L. Agitators Can Provide a Spark in the Playoffs

2017-04-24.abstract: Emma G. Fitzsimmons, who covers New York City transit for The Times, finds story ideas on buses and bridges, in bike lanes and subway cars.
2017-04-24.snippet: Emma G. Fitzsimmons, who covers New York City transit for The Times, finds story ideas on buses and bridges, in bike lanes and subway cars.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: For many New Yorkers, the daily commute is an opportunity to zone out: to listen to music; to read; to take a break from work. For Emma G. Fitzsimmons, riding the subway is work — and the perfect chance to ask lots of questions. Why are there so many dogs on leashes if they’re all supposed to be in closed carriers? Why are service announcements so impossible to understand? What’s the best way to confront a passenger who is manspreading?
2017-04-24.headline_main: A Reporter Whose Sources Are Strangers on the Train

2017-04-24.abstract: Mr. Dickey prevented the government from investigating the public health effects of gun violence, but long after leaving office, he did an about-face.
2017-04-24.snippet: Mr. Dickey prevented the government from investigating the public health effects of gun violence, but long after leaving office, he did an about-face.
2017-04-24.lead_paragraph: As a Republican congressman from Arkansas, Jay Dickey, through an obscure amendment, single-handedly prevented the federal government from investigating the public health effects of firearms-inflicted violence for the last two decades.
2017-04-24.headline_main: Jay Dickey, Arkansas Lawmaker Who Blocked Gun Research, Dies at 77

2017-04-24.abstract: Nearly 33,000 public school students were in temporary housing in the 2015-16 school year, an increase of 4,000 students from the previous academic year.
2017-04-24.snippet: Nearly 33,000 public school students were in temporary housing in the 2015-16 school year, an increase of 4,000 students from the previous academic year.

Pirsig, whose “Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance,” a dense and discursive novel of ideas, became an unlikely publishing phenomenon in the mid-1970s and a touchstone in the waning days of the counterculture, died on Monday at his home in South Berwick, Me. 2017-04-25.snippet: Though he has called it “an artificial barrier” and a “ridiculous standard,” President Trump is deeply anxious that he be judged a success after 100 days.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In case anyone was wondering, President Trump wants it known that he does not care about the false judgment of his administration after just 100 days. “It’s an artificial barrier,” he sniffed the other day. “Not very meaningful,” he scoffed. A “ridiculous standard,” he added on Twitter.

2017-04-25.abstract: This epic musical about an amnesiac princess suffers from its own identity crisis.
2017-04-25.snippet: This epic musical about an amnesiac princess suffers from its own identity crisis.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The amnesiac title character of “Anastasia,” who may or may not be the long-lost daughter of the last Russian czar, isn’t alone in suffering a serious identity crisis. The postcard-scenic show that bears her name, which opened on Monday night at the Broadhurst Theater, has its own troubling case of multiple personality disorder.

2017-04-25.abstract: Mr. Bogdanov also directed plays by Molière, Goethe, Chekhov, Gogol and Dylan Thomas, as well as musicals and operas. But a contemporary play nearly put him in jail.
2017-04-25.snippet: Mr. Bogdanov also directed plays by Molière, Goethe, Chekhov, Gogol and Dylan Thomas, as well as musicals and operas. But a contemporary play nearly put him in jail.

He was 78.

But everyone seems to think I’ve got it all under control, and I rarely feel that way. There’s a ticking clock always in the back of my mind. I need to graduate and become financially independent before the support I get from the foster care system disappears.

2017-04-25.abstract: A question posed without a question mark becomes something else entirely.
2017-04-25.snippet: A question posed without a question mark becomes something else entirely.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: What does a question mark do? It looks and acts sort of like an ear, waiting at the end of a sentence for an answer. “Where are you going?” we might ask, and our voice will naturally rise to signal curiosity, and whomever we’re asking will tell us they’re going out for ice cream or to a petting zoo or to work, and we will consider our question answered, transaction complete.
2017-04-25.headline_main: New Sentences: From ‘Writing to Save a Life: The Louis Till File,’ by John Edgar Wideman

2017-04-25.abstract: Sports betting offers the prospect of restoring an older, purer version of fandom — rooting for teams over players.
2017-04-25.snippet: Sports betting offers the prospect of restoring an older, purer version of fandom — rooting for teams over players.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: In the early 1990s, Bill Bradley, the New Jersey senator and former New York Knick, argued several times in front of Congress that legalizing sports betting would dehumanize athletes and lead to the rampant corruption of children. This was no cynical political crusade; Bradley was a true believer. He liked to declare that athletes were not “roulette chips” and tell the story of a game he once played in Madison Square Garden. His Knicks were up by 5 at the end when the other team hit a meaningless basket to cut the final lead to 3. A confused Bradley heard cheers in the crowd, and when someone told him why — the opponent had just lost by fewer points and beat the spread predicted by oddsmakers — his eyes were opened to the sordid callousness of the gambling world. Bradley helped push through the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act in 1992, all but banning sports betting outside Nevada and driving a growing industry that employed hundreds underground.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Could Legalized Gambling Save Us From the Insufferability of Fantasy Sports?

2017-04-25.abstract: Mark Zuckerberg now acknowledges the dangerous side of the social revolution he helped start. But is the most powerful tool for connection in human history capable of adapting to the world it created?
2017-04-25.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg now acknowledges the dangerous side of the social revolution he helped start. But is the most powerful tool for connection in human history capable of adapting to the world it created?
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: In early January, I went to see Mark Zuckerberg at MPK20, a concrete-and-steel building on the campus of Facebook’s headquarters, which sits across a desolate highway from the marshy salt flats of Menlo Park, Calif. The Frank Gehry-designed building has a pristine nine-acre rooftop garden, yet much of the interior — a meandering open-plan hallway — appears unfinished. There are exposed air ducts and I-beams scribbled with contractors’ marks. Many of the internal walls are unpainted plywood. The space looks less like the headquarters of one of the world’s wealthiest companies and more like a Chipotle with standing desks. It’s an aesthetic meant to reflect — and perhaps also inspire employee allegiance to — one of Facebook’s founding ideologies: that things are never quite finished, that nothing is permanent, that you should always look for a chance to take an ax to your surroundings.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Can Facebook Fix Its Own Worst Bug?

2017-04-25.abstract: Over the past century, it has grown from an abstract notion into a sprawling system of barriers and rules — one that stretches far beyond the country’s perimeter.
2017-04-25.snippet: Over the past century, it has grown from an abstract notion into a sprawling system of barriers and rules — one that stretches far beyond the country’s perimeter.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The Border Patrol agent watched our Prius approach, then signaled for us to stop. Behind him stood several others in green uniforms, hands resting on holsters, eyes hidden behind sunglasses. German shepherds panted in the heat. “Are you all U.S. citizens?” the agent asked, leaning against the driver’s-side window and glancing around our car. “Yes,” said one of my companions, an artist from Iowa. “Yes,” echoed the other, a poet from Connecticut. Then it was my turn. “Yes,” I said. The agent’s gaze lingered on me for a moment. Then he stood up and waved us through the border.
2017-04-25.headline_main: The Border Is All Around Us, and It’s Growing

2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Oregon had never seemed so nasty. For two long days in 2013, I had bicycled south with two intrepid college friends along its coast, into a relentless gale, the rainy headwinds leaving us exhausted, our flat tires as frequent as East Coast potholes. Now we sat soaked on the side of a piney road, in the middle of nowhere, with no place to stay.

2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The longest elevated pedestrian bridge in the world, Walkway Over the Hudson State Historic Park, rises 212 feet above the river and is easily reached by a glass enclosed, 21-story waterfront elevator in Poughkeepsie. On any given day — barring high winds, thunderstorms and lightning — power-walkers, dog-walkers, bicyclists, runners, parents pushing strollers, couples holding hands and people with limited mobility navigate the flat mile and a quarter crossing.

2017-04-25.abstract: Empire Diner unveils its latest iteration, chef moves and other restaurant news.
2017-04-25.snippet: Empire Diner unveils its latest iteration, chef moves and other restaurant news.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: MADE NICE Fast-casual fare in the hands of Daniel Humm and Will Guidara doesn’t yield your usual assembly-line bowl. For one thing, the nine or so items on the menu, to eat in or take out and ordered from an employee holding an iPad, do not accommodate substitutions. For another, some of the food, like the soup, is dispensed with high style from heavy Mauviel copper pots. But whether you choose the salmon rosti with smoked salmon, egg, salad and pickled onions, or the quinoa falafel with pickled beets, yogurt, cucumber and salad, it’s all still served in disposable bowls. Starting next week, after 5 p.m., there will be roast chicken. For dessert, the milk and honey ice cream is a play on an Eleven Madison Park classic. (In fact, many of the bowl components grew out of Mr. Humm’s food at his other restaurants.) The restaurant, which is splashed with a Shepard Fairey mural, can seat 31. The back half of the room is the open kitchen: 8 West 28th Street, 212-887-1677, madenicenyc.com.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Made Nice, the Latest From Daniel Humm and Will Guidara, Opens

2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump sent a powerful message to those who doubt his will to fight anti-Semitism — and to his own supporters in the white nationalist movement — during an annual Holocaust remembrance ceremony at the Capitol on Tuesday.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Trump Takes Forceful Tone at Holocaust Remembrance: ‘Never Again’

2017-04-25.abstract: The closing of St. Anthony High School in Jersey City means that the best players from its famed basketball team are free to switch high schools.
2017-04-25.snippet: The closing of St. Anthony High School in Jersey City means that the best players from its famed basketball team are free to switch high schools.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: When the news broke on April 5 that St. Anthony High School in Jersey City would shut down at the end of the 2016-17 school year, the school’s famed basketball coach, Bob Hurley, and his assistant Eric Harrield began fielding phone calls from coaches at other high schools. While the callers were ostensibly phoning to commiserate, and to offer their condolences on the shuttering of the school made famous by Hurley and his powerhouse teams, Hurley and Harrield knew they had another motive.
2017-04-25.headline_main: In St. Anthony’s Final Days, a Scramble to Recruit Its Best Talent

2017-04-25.abstract: The governing bodies will favor a player’s “reasonable judgment” over the precision of video evidence in making rules decisions.
2017-04-25.snippet: The governing bodies will favor a player’s “reasonable judgment” over the precision of video evidence in making rules decisions.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The governing bodies that oversee golf’s rule book relied on a dose of common sense on Tuesday by swiftly and decisively mitigating how much video evidence can influence rules decisions at televised events. The new procedure, which is not a new rule but a new decision (labeled 34-3/10) to the Rules of Golf, in effect limits the use of advanced video technology — like high-definition or super-slow-motion cameras — in making rulings.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Golf’s Ruling Bodies Limit Influence of Video Evidence

2017-04-25.abstract: Salt has a greater impact on flavor than anything else. Learn to use it well, and your food will be good.
2017-04-25.snippet: Salt has a greater impact on flavor than anything else. Learn to use it well, and your food will be good.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Growing up, I thought salt belonged in a shaker at the table, and nowhere else.
2017-04-25.headline_main: The Single Most Important Ingredient

2017-04-25.abstract: The bequest from the estate of the artist, who died last year, is being described as the largest gift of art in the Buffalo museum’s history.
2017-04-25.snippet: The bequest from the estate of the artist, who died last year, is being described as the largest gift of art in the Buffalo museum’s history.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: In what the museum is describing as the largest gift of art in its history, the Albright-Knox Art Gallery in Buffalo is scheduled to announce Tuesday that it has been given the entire estate of Marisol, a Venezuelan-American artist who fused Pop Art imagery and folk art in assemblages and sculptures and who captivated the New York art world in the 1960s with her mysterious Garboesque persona.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Marisol Estate Is Given to the Albright-Knox Art Gallery

2017-04-25.abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called off a session with the German foreign minister on Tuesday after the minister met with a group opposed to the occupation of Palestinian territories.
2017-04-25.snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called off a session with the German foreign minister on Tuesday after the minister met with a group opposed to the occupation of Palestinian territories.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — It was hardly the first time a top-level meeting had been canceled over hard feelings. But when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called off a session with the German foreign minister here on Tuesday, it seemed a particularly sharp reflection of the tension within Israel, and with its allies, these days.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Israeli Leader Cancels Meeting After German Official Visits Protest Group

2017-04-25.abstract: The three Americans now detained in North Korea are being held at a time of heightened tensions with the West.
2017-04-25.snippet: The three Americans now detained in North Korea are being held at a time of heightened tensions with the West.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: When Americans are detained in North Korea, they can expect harsh conditions, with tiny prison cells, little food or water and even less daylight. And their story line is preordained: A forced confession, a show trial, a sentence to years of hard labor with little chance of appeal.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Imprisoned in North Korea: The Cases of 3 Americans

2017-04-25.abstract: After an extended break from competition, Azarenka is training in her native Belarus with a new coach and a new traveling companion: her infant son.
2017-04-25.snippet: After an extended break from competition, Azarenka is training in her native Belarus with a new coach and a new traveling companion: her infant son.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: MINSK, Belarus — The child care was done, if only for a moment, and Victoria Azarenka was back where it all began, leaning against the wall that had been her first tennis companion.
2017-04-25.headline_main: With Baby in Tow, Victoria Azarenka Returns to Tennis — and Her Roots

2017-04-25.abstract: Experts urged caution because the statement was posted on a site used by terrorists in North Africa, not a normal venue for claims about attacks in Europe.
2017-04-25.snippet: Experts urged caution because the statement was posted on a site used by terrorists in North Africa, not a normal venue for claims about attacks in Europe.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A website that has previously carried Al Qaeda messages on Tuesday issued a claim of responsibility for the recent subway bombing in St. Petersburg, Russia, publishing a statement from a previously unknown cell said to be working on behalf of the terrorist group.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Website With Qaeda Ties Publishes Claim on St. Petersburg Bombing

2017-04-25.snippet: Talk of a corporate tax cut helped fuel a stock rally, but executives say it is too soon to judge whether the president can deliver on his promises.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The investor enthusiasm that began with President Trump’s unexpected victory in November has burst out anew on Wall Street, even as Washington remains gridlocked and evidence of any real pickup in the economy is scarce.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Trump Rides a Market Wave, but Business Looks for Results

2017-04-25.abstract: The lawsuit said that Chobani has suffered after a report on InfoWars connecting the factory with a child sexual assault because it involved refugees, whom Chobani has made a policy of hiring.
2017-04-25.snippet: The lawsuit said that Chobani has suffered after a report on InfoWars connecting the factory with a child sexual assault because it involved refugees, whom Chobani has made a policy of hiring.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Chobani, the yogurt company, has filed a lawsuit against Alex Jones, the high-profile conspiracy theorist and the host of a popular right-wing radio show, for posting what it called false news reports about the company and its owner.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Chobani Yogurt Sues Alex Jones Over Sexual Assault Report

2017-04-25.abstract: To understand the appeal of political figures who mangle the truth, it helps to understand the wrestling concept of “kayfabe.”
2017-04-25.snippet: To understand the appeal of political figures who mangle the truth, it helps to understand the wrestling concept of “kayfabe.”
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Alex Jones, the conspiracist at the helm of the alt-news outlet InfoWars, used an unusual defense in a custody hearing in Texas last week. His ex-wife had accused him of being unstable and dangerous, citing Mr. Jones’s rants on his daily call-in show. (Among his many unconventional stances are that the government staged the Sandy Hook massacre and orchestrated the 9/11 attacks.) Through his attorneys, Mr. Jones countered that his antics are irrelevant to his fitness as a parent, because he is a performance artist whose public behavior is part of his fictional character. In other words, when he tells his audience that Hillary Clinton is running a sex-trafficking operation out of a Washington pizza parlor (an accusation for which he has offered a rare retraction), he is doing so merely for entertainment value.
2017-04-25.headline_main: How Wrestling Explains Alex Jones and Donald Trump

2017-04-25.abstract: The Kenya-based brand features only one style in an array of fabrics.
2017-04-25.snippet: The Kenya-based brand features only one style in an array of fabrics.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The Kenya-based brand features only one style in an array of fabrics.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Zuri, a Brand of Colorful Dresses

2017-04-25.abstract: Zuri, founded this year by two expats living in Nairobi, produces a single style — in a vibrant array of African fabrics.
2017-04-25.snippet: Zuri, founded this year by two expats living in Nairobi, produces a single style — in a vibrant array of African fabrics.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: When preparing for a trip to South Sudan last May, the American designer Sandra Zhao’s packing list was straightforward: “I wanted something I could shove in a backpack, that wouldn’t look like I’d just shoved it in a backpack.” Zhao, a New York City transplant, was living in Nairobi, where it’s fast and cheap to have clothes tailored, so she designed the dress she had in mind: resistant to wrinkling, airy enough for the equatorial sun and long enough (in sleeves and skirt) to be culturally appropriate. The resulting piece — a tunic-style dress that’s fitted in the shoulders and loose through the body — hit all the marks. It also, remarkably, looked good. Zhao traveled in the dress; then she started living in it.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Brand to Know: The Kenyan Line That Makes Only One Dress

2017-04-25.abstract: The owners of Gurney’s Montauk, a luxury resort on the tip of Long Island, N.Y., are hoping to replicate their success in the seaside city of Newport.
2017-04-25.snippet: The owners of Gurney’s Montauk, a luxury resort on the tip of Long Island, N.Y., are hoping to replicate their success in the seaside city of Newport.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, R.I. — After a makeover that made it into a luxury destination at the easternmost tip of the Hamptons on Long Island, N.Y., Gurney’s Montauk Resort and Seawater Spa is bringing its name to another seaside hot spot: Newport, R.I.
2017-04-25.headline_main: A Hamptons Hotel Taps Into Rhode Island’s Beach Scene

2017-04-25.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-04-25.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2017-04-25.headline_main: North Korea, France, Ivanka Trump: Your Morning Briefing

2017-04-25.abstract: The legitimacy of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s victory in a referendum has been tainted by fraud accusations and by a series of erratic decisions by jurists on the electoral commission.
2017-04-25.snippet: The legitimacy of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s victory in a referendum has been tainted by fraud accusations and by a series of erratic decisions by jurists on the electoral commission.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey — The credibility of the judges who oversaw Turkey’s referendum last week is being called into question because most of them were hastily appointed when President Recep Tayyip Erdogan purged the judiciary after last summer’s failed coup.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Critics in Turkey Question Credibility of Judges Who Oversaw Vote

2017-04-25.abstract: An unclear No. 2 pick and a number of players whose draft position is anybody’s guess are making the task, never easy, a particular test of mettle.
2017-04-25.snippet: An unclear No. 2 pick and a number of players whose draft position is anybody’s guess are making the task, never easy, a particular test of mettle.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Making a mock N.F.L. draft is not easy. Divining the intentions of 32 teams, evaluating scores of players, factoring in potential trades and coming up with a list of picks that makes sense tests the mettle of even the most informed fan or pundit.
2017-04-25.headline_main: One Certain Projection in Mock N.F.L. Drafts This Year: Uncertainty

2017-04-25.abstract: When a public figure utters a slur and news organizations use euphemisms to describe it, a question comes up: Who’s really being protected?
2017-04-25.snippet: When a public figure utters a slur and news organizations use euphemisms to describe it, a question comes up: Who’s really being protected?
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: It isn’t often that editors at The New York Times consider using the “N-word” in a story. But one noteworthy occasion arose last week when a Florida state senator went on a profanity-soaked tirade in an exclusive club with other colleagues. The senator, Frank Artiles, used not just that word but a raft of other epithets that led first to an apology and four days later to his resignation.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Intemperate Words, Temperate News Coverage

2017-04-25.abstract: Buying AdvancePierre will help Tyson Foods further reduce its dependence on the volatile commodity meat business. But it is paying a big premium to do so.
2017-04-25.snippet: Buying AdvancePierre will help Tyson Foods further reduce its dependence on the volatile commodity meat business. But it is paying a big premium to do so.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Tyson Foods has found a delectable new bite to swallow in its quest to become America’s premier protein provider from the farmyard to the kitchen table. The $3.2 billion purchase of AdvancePierre, a ready-to-eat sandwich maker, takes the Springdale, Ark.-based poultry company further up the food value chain. Along with plans to carve off some less wholesome morsels, Tyson is giving investors plenty to cluck about.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Tyson Foods Continues Expansion With Takeover of Sandwich Maker

2017-04-25.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced plans for an esplanade to shrink the East Side gap between 41st and 61st Streets in the Manhattan Waterfront Greenway.
2017-04-25.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced plans for an esplanade to shrink the East Side gap between 41st and 61st Streets in the Manhattan Waterfront Greenway.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The waterfront parkland that rings Manhattan is filled with flowers, trees, bushes, walkways and bike paths — and then there’s the East Side of the island.
2017-04-25.headline_main: City Commits $100 Million to Narrowing a Gap in Manhattan Greenway

2017-04-25.abstract: Officials say the move, which would cause huge disruptions for commuters, is needed because infrastructure at the terminal urgently needs an overhaul.
2017-04-25.snippet: Officials say the move, which would cause huge disruptions for commuters, is needed because infrastructure at the terminal urgently needs an overhaul.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: After two derailments at Pennsylvania Station in New York, Amtrak officials are considering closing tracks at the station for an extended period to make long-term repairs — a drastic move that would cause huge disruptions for tens of thousands of commuters, according to officials who were briefed on the plans.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Amtrak Said to Weigh Extended Track Closings for Penn Station Repairs

2017-04-25.abstract: A group including Jeter and Jeb Bush, the former Florida governor and presidential candidate, is said to have reached an agreement in principle to buy the Miami Marlins.
2017-04-25.snippet: A group including Jeter and Jeb Bush, the former Florida governor and presidential candidate, is said to have reached an agreement in principle to buy the Miami Marlins.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Derek Jeter has always said that his long-term ambition was to own a major league team. Now, less than three years into his retirement, he appears to be closing in on his chance.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Derek Jeter and Jeb Bush Are Said to Move Closer to Purchase of Marlins

2017-04-25.abstract: Clare de Boer and Jess Shadbolt, the culinary talent behind King, on how to make a savory, packable, classic French tart.
2017-04-25.snippet: Clare de Boer and Jess Shadbolt, the culinary talent behind King, on how to make a savory, packable, classic French tart.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: At King, the recently opened restaurant in West SoHo from chefs Clare de Boer and Jess Shadbolt, the menu is always a bit up in the air. “I think the way we cook in the kitchen is very similar to how someone would cook in their farmhouse in Provence. We don’t use recipes,” de Boer says. “We just cook what we fancy for dinner that night.” Lately, that’s been everything from whipped salt cod with grilled polenta to rose veal with artichokes, which the duo — who are alums of the River Café in London — creates using fresh, seasonal ingredients sourced from farmers’ markets and local purveyors. Though the menu changes daily, there has been one mainstay since the bistro debuted last fall: panisse, a crispy Provençal snack made with chickpea flour. “We like to have a cold drink and a few fingers of panisse ourselves so it’s one of the things that sticks to the menu,” de Boer says. “We’ve been open for seven months now, and we still enjoy it.”
2017-04-25.headline_main: A Spring Picnic Recipe From Two Rising N.Y.C. Chefs

2017-04-25.abstract: Francis’ remarks were shocking, but they were shocking for a purpose.
2017-04-25.snippet: Francis’ remarks were shocking, but they were shocking for a purpose.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Until last weekend, Pope Francis earned nothing but praise from the American Jewish Committee. But when the pope, speaking off the cuff, likened European migrant and refugee holding centers to concentration camps, the advocacy group’s response was swift and sharp.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Was the Pope Wrong to Compare Refugee Centers to Concentration Camps?

2017-04-25.abstract: The poet and the choreographer team up for a work that meshes language and dance to address an open-ended question about surveillance and being human.
2017-04-25.snippet: The poet and the choreographer team up for a work that meshes language and dance to address an open-ended question about surveillance and being human.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: It was a sticky June day in the financial district when the choreographer Will Rawls, still recovering from a performance of his piece “The Planet Eaters,” first met the poet Claudia Rankine. She and her husband, the filmmaker John Lucas, were investigating his work for a potential collaboration merging poetry, video and dance.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Claudia Rankine and Will Rawls: Surveillance and the Black Experience

2017-04-25.abstract: The body and the mind commune in “Poor People’s TV Room,” a work at New York Live Arts that was partly inspired by women’s resistance movements in Nigeria.
2017-04-25.snippet: The body and the mind commune in “Poor People’s TV Room,” a work at New York Live Arts that was partly inspired by women’s resistance movements in Nigeria.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Okwui Okpokwasili’s “Poor People’s TV Room” is as dense and delicate as a centuries-old tapestry. It can be oblique, but it’s also alive as it drifts through myriad subjects to conjure a surreal, imaginary place where, you get the distinct feeling, women have long been oppressed and ignored, or worse: treated like victims.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Review: Okwui Okpokwasili Gives Voice to the Ignored and Oppressed

2017-04-25.abstract: If you care about inequality, you can’t ignore reproductive rights.
2017-04-25.snippet: If you care about inequality, you can’t ignore reproductive rights.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The Democrats’ unity tour fractured into disunity almost immediately after it began. Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont refused to say whether Jon Ossoff, the Democratic candidate trying to win a typically Republican district in Georgia while being outspoken in support of abortion rights, counts as a progressive. He then went on to stump for Heath Mello in Nebraska. Mr. Mello, who is running for mayor in Omaha, has sponsored legislation aimed at restricting women’s access to abortion, including a bill in 2009 that required women to be informed that they could look at ultrasounds of their fetuses.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Why Abortion Is a Progressive Economic Issue

2017-04-25.abstract: Ms. Paz’s solo at the Chocolate Factory refers to her teacher in Buenos Aires and honors the beauty of a dancer engaged in daily practice.
2017-04-25.snippet: Ms. Paz’s solo at the Chocolate Factory refers to her teacher in Buenos Aires and honors the beauty of a dancer engaged in daily practice.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: The first scream is a shock. In the middle of an enigmatic solo, performed largely in silence in the intimate confines of the Chocolate Factory, it’s unsettling when the dancer shrieks like a horror movie victim. The second and third screams are less jolting, folded in with calmer activities, but they still stick out among the mysteries of Jimena Paz’s “Yellow,” such as: Why does the performance take place two hours before sunset?
2017-04-25.headline_main: Review: Jimena Paz’s ‘Yellow’ Glows Radiant in the Dusk

2017-04-25.abstract: Kurdish officials said that one Turkish airstrike mistakenly struck Kurdish pesh merga troops on Mount Sinjar in northwestern Iraq, killing at least five.
2017-04-25.snippet: Kurdish officials said that one Turkish airstrike mistakenly struck Kurdish pesh merga troops on Mount Sinjar in northwestern Iraq, killing at least five.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: ERBIL, Iraq — Turkish warplanes bombed Kurdish fighters in Iraq and Syria on Tuesday in an unusually intense operation that presented a new complication for the United States’ military campaign against the Islamic State.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Turkish Strikes Target Kurdish Allies of U.S. in Iraq and Syria

2017-04-25.abstract: Readers of an article on a hard-working Manhattan food-cart vendor felt the man deserved a vacation. So they did something about it.
2017-04-25.snippet: Readers of an article on a hard-working Manhattan food-cart vendor felt the man deserved a vacation. So they did something about it.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: I had hoped readers would enjoy following a food vendor around on the streets of Manhattan for a day, but I hadn’t expected the story I wrote about Kabir Ahmed to take on a life of its own.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Crowdfunding a Well-Deserved Break

2017-04-25.abstract: Two female flight attendants who sued Aeroflot for age and sex discrimination were upbraided at a news conference by two men defending the airline.
2017-04-25.snippet: Two female flight attendants who sued Aeroflot for age and sex discrimination were upbraided at a news conference by two men defending the airline.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — By Russian standards, the news conference on Tuesday was unusual: an airing of grievances by two female flight attendants who had taken the rare step of suing Aeroflot, the country’s flag carrier, for age and sex discrimination.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Aeroflot Workers Are Told Passengers Want Attractive Flight Crews

2017-04-25.abstract: Mr. Marius’s Entertainers Basketball Classic at Rucker Park in Harlem featured playground legends, professional basketball players, corporate sponsors and exuberant crowds.
2017-04-25.snippet: Mr. Marius’s Entertainers Basketball Classic at Rucker Park in Harlem featured playground legends, professional basketball players, corporate sponsors and exuberant crowds.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Greg Marius, who helped make street basketball big business when he founded a tournament in Harlem that let playground standouts share the court with professional stars in a raucous atmosphere of dazzling play, hip-hop music and exuberant crowds, died on Saturday in Harlem. He was 59.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Greg Marius, Impresario of Harlem Street Ball, Dies at 59

2017-04-25.abstract: The documentary peers over the shoulders of journalists at The New York Times as they decide who merits obituaries and then go about the delicate business of writing them.
2017-04-25.snippet: The documentary peers over the shoulders of journalists at The New York Times as they decide who merits obituaries and then go about the delicate business of writing them.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: As a reviewer, I wouldn’t blame readers if this section weren’t the first thing they turned to in their newspapers. It is, after all, some distance from the obituaries, and priorities are priorities. Perhaps, they too are inclined to read the obits as soon as possible, even to the point of bypassing the front page — unless of course it carries a piece about somebody famous who died, unexpectedly or not.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Review: ‘Obit’ Follows the Team That Writes Death Notices for The Times

2017-04-25.abstract: A weeklong hearing is being held as officials consider charges against jail workers in the dehydration death of Terrill Thomas, 38, in April 2016.
2017-04-25.snippet: A weeklong hearing is being held as officials consider charges against jail workers in the dehydration death of Terrill Thomas, 38, in April 2016.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Inmates, correction officers and investigators are testifying in Milwaukee this week to help determine whether jail employees will be charged with abuse in the dehydration death of an inmate who the authorities say was deprived of water for a week.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Milwaukee Inmate Died After Being Deprived of Water for 7 Days

2017-04-25.abstract: Outlaws stole millions of dollars at a cash transporting company in Ciudad del Este, a Paraguayan city on the so-called Triple Frontier where Paraguay, Brazil and Argentina meet.
2017-04-25.snippet: Outlaws stole millions of dollars at a cash transporting company in Ciudad del Este, a Paraguayan city on the so-called Triple Frontier where Paraguay, Brazil and Argentina meet.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The heist was cinematically daring even for the South American borderland famed as a smuggler’s haven.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Deadly Heist Shakes a South American Borderland Trying to Shed Its Lawless Image

2017-04-25.abstract: Berns is not as well known as Phil Spector, but this songwriter and music producer amassed an impressive number of durable pop and R&B hits in the 1960s.
2017-04-25.snippet: Berns is not as well known as Phil Spector, but this songwriter and music producer amassed an impressive number of durable pop and R&B hits in the 1960s.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: His career barely spanned a decade, but the songwriter, record producer and music entrepreneur Bert Berns put his fingerprints on a sufficient number of pop and R&B hits in the 1960s to amass a canon that rivals Phil Spector’s. As it happens, a new documentary about Berns’s too-short life (he died in 1967 at 38), “Bang! The Bert Berns Story,” reveals that he resolved to take more control over his music after witnessing Mr. Spector botch one of his songs in a studio session for Atlantic Records.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Review: ‘Bang! The Bert Berns Story,’ With Juicy Showbiz Lore

2017-04-25.abstract: Sara Baume’s second novel follows a 25-year-old Irishwoman (one who cries all day) down the rabbit hole of elegiac distress.
2017-04-25.snippet: Sara Baume’s second novel follows a 25-year-old Irishwoman (one who cries all day) down the rabbit hole of elegiac distress.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: A LINE MADE BY WALKINGBy Sara Baume308 pages. Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. $25.
2017-04-25.headline_main: An Artist Fears She’s a Fraud in ‘A Line Made by Walking’

2017-04-25.abstract: A federal judge in California temporarily halted the administration’s efforts to withhold funding from cities that limit their cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.
2017-04-25.snippet: A federal judge in California temporarily halted the administration’s efforts to withhold funding from cities that limit their cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: A judge in San Francisco on Tuesday temporarily blocked President Trump’s efforts to starve localities of federal funds when they limit their cooperation with immigration enforcement, a stinging rejection of his threats to make so-called sanctuary cities fall in line.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Judge Blocks Trump Effort to Withhold Money From Sanctuary Cities

2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Forces fighting for the future of New York City’s fashion industry came to a head on Monday evening in the less-than-chic but nevertheless most fitting of places: the auditorium at the High School of Fashion Industries in Manhattan.

2017-04-25.abstract: A Puente retrospective at the Hostos Center offered three days of performances, discussions and workshops in the Bronx, a rarity for the city’s Latin music tradition.
2017-04-25.snippet: A Puente retrospective at the Hostos Center offered three days of performances, discussions and workshops in the Bronx, a rarity for the city’s Latin music tradition.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: There was a sense of long-awaited catharsis on Saturday night at the Hostos Center for the Arts and Culture in the South Bronx, as the Mambo Legends Orchestra plowed through a blazing set of Tito Puente’s most famous tunes. It was a proud capstone on the center’s three-day festival, Tito Puente Retrospective: 50 Years of ‘El Rey,’ which was both a celebration and a corrective.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Bringing Tito Puente’s Fire to a New Generation

2017-04-25.abstract: Mr. Barber’s 1995 book presciently analyzed the forces leading to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and the rise in tribalism around the world.
2017-04-25.snippet: Mr. Barber’s 1995 book presciently analyzed the forces leading to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and the rise in tribalism around the world.
2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: Benjamin R. Barber, a political theorist whose 1995 book, “Jihad vs. McWorld,” presciently analyzed the socioeconomic forces leading to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and a surge in tribalism around the world, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 77.
2017-04-25.headline_main: Benjamin R. Barber, Author of ‘Jihad vs. McWorld,’ Dies at 77

2017-04-25.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The far-right leader Marine Le Pen faces an uphill battle in France’s presidential runoff, less than two weeks away. But she saw daylight through a small window on Tuesday, and from an unlikely source: her defeated counterpart on the far left.

Two radically disparate presentations in recent days struck glancing blows at the matter and suggested fascinating if not always comfortable glimpses into Bach’s thought processes.

2017-04-26.abstract: The theory, four decades old, that cutting taxes spurs enough growth to generate new tax revenue underpins President Trump’s tax plan.
2017-04-26.snippet: The theory, four decades old, that cutting taxes spurs enough growth to generate new tax revenue underpins President Trump’s tax plan.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A white cloth napkin, now displayed in the National Museum of American History, helped change the course of modern economics. On it, the economist Arthur Laffer in 1974 sketched a curve meant to illustrate his theory that cutting taxes would spur enough economic growth to generate new tax revenue.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Arthur Laffer’s Theory on Tax Cuts Comes to Life Once More

2017-04-26.abstract: Mr. Wielgus oversaw great Olympic success but was criticized for his response to accusations of sexual abuse by coaches.

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: Chuck Wielgus, who as the top official in American swimming was credited with doing more than anyone to make it the nation’s premier Summer Olympics sport, but who was later scarred by his response to accusations of sexual abuse by coaches, died on Sunday in Colorado Springs. He was 67.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Chuck Wielgus, 67, Dies; Empowered U.S. Swimming and Apologized in a Scandal

2017-04-26.abstract: Even if it is eliminated by the Toronto Raptors, a team with more playoff experience, Milwaukee has budding stars like Malcolm Brogdon, Giannis Antetokounmpo and Thon Maker.
2017-04-26.snippet: Even if it is eliminated by the Toronto Raptors, a team with more playoff experience, Milwaukee has budding stars like Malcolm Brogdon, Giannis Antetokounmpo and Thon Maker.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — The Milwaukee Bucks are one loss away from elimination. The N.B.A. playoffs do not slow down for any team, not even for one as precocious as the Bucks. It could all come to an end for them against the Toronto Raptors on Thursday in Game 6 of their first-round playoff series. But even if the Bucks lose, it will still feel as if they are just getting started.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Bucks, a Youthful Bunch, Are Facing a Bright Future

He lived in a double-wide trailer on property owned by his famous father, a seven-time Nascar champion, and worked at his father’s Chevrolet dealership, toiling on brake repairs and lube jobs.

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — As a former college student at a school that was nicknamed “Molson University” for good reason, I can tell you with confidence that people in college drink a good deal of beer. It’s relatively inexpensive, it’s easy to acquire and it does its job of taking the edge off or making the imbiber feel more grown up.

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: That dangerous young man who calls himself Paul Poitier has grown up in the 27 years since he first set foot on a New York stage. All right, perhaps not “grown up,” since we’re still talking about a narcissistic con artist of adolescent fecklessness and zero self-knowledge. But there’s no doubt that he has grown in stature and, in a paradoxical way, truthfulness.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Review: A Scam Artist’s Masterwork in ‘Six Degrees of Separation’

2017-04-26.abstract: Bit by bit, Elizabeth the patriot is learning to cede space to Elizabeth the wife and mother.
2017-04-26.snippet: Bit by bit, Elizabeth the patriot is learning to cede space to Elizabeth the wife and mother.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: What’s the opposite of a cliffhanger? Whatever it is, that’s what “The Americans” ended on this week. It wasn’t an anticlimax — more like a diminuendo. A mother and daughter taking a walk in the woods, sharing thoughts, and the mom — whom we know as a rigid political idealist and killing machine — musing that if she weren’t a spy, she’d like to be a doctor. The daughter finding this funny, given her mom’s lack of “bedside manner.”
2017-04-26.headline_main: ‘The Americans,’ Season 5, Episode 8: The Humanization of Elizabeth

2017-04-26.headline_main: Cybernetics, Cesarean Sections and Soccer’s Most Magnificent Mind

2017-04-26.abstract: Port Arthur, the famous prison that housed the British Empire’s toughest convicts in the 19th century, is facing an onslaught from the sea.
2017-04-26.snippet: Port Arthur, the famous prison that housed the British Empire’s toughest convicts in the 19th century, is facing an onslaught from the sea.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: ISLE OF THE DEAD, Tasmania — Maybe the hardened convicts who carved the 19th-century gravestones dotting this tiny island were barely literate, or perhaps one of them just had a wicked sense of humor. The schoolmaster Benjamin Horne went to his repose in 1843 with this sentence chiseled above his head: “Sincerely regretted by all who knew him.”
2017-04-26.headline_main: As Rising Seas Erode Shorelines, Tasmania Shows What Can Be Lost

2017-04-26.abstract: Threats and rhetoric have given way to a more complicated reality, and fiscal policy that can do more damage than bad trade deals.
2017-04-26.snippet: Threats and rhetoric have given way to a more complicated reality, and fiscal policy that can do more damage than bad trade deals.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s populist, antitrade deal rhetoric was always hard to believe coming from someone who outsourced production of his clothes and other merchandise to low-wage countries like China. Now it is becoming clearer that he has no coherent plan to lower the trade deficit or bring back lost manufacturing jobs. In fact, Mr. Trump’s promise of huge tax cuts might actually increase the trade deficit and hurt the very workers he says he supports.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Trade Policy Is in Disarray

2017-04-26.abstract: Passing judgment on Trump’s first 100 days.
2017-04-26.snippet: Passing judgment on Trump’s first 100 days.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: The first 100 days of Donald Trump’s presidency have not been exactly what you could call successful, by the standards that one would normally use to judge such things. No significant legislation has passed Congress, and indeed it has become painfully clear that this White House has no real sense of what legislation it would even like to pass. There has been no political honeymoon: For this stage of an administration, Trump is the most unpopular president of modern times. Important areas of the executive branch are barely staffed or functioning, the White House is in a state of low-grade civil war, and the bungling, pratfalls, conflicts of interest, weak attempts at propaganda and brazen lying are all, well, not normal, as the self-styled “resistance” likes to say.
2017-04-26.headline_main: It Could Be Worse

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — President Trump has already played an incredible amount of golf in his first 100 days. He says he needs the break. I sympathize. In fact, I need a break, too — from him, from writing about his relentless assault on truth and science. It’s toxic. So I break today to write about … golf — in Dubai, where I recently participated in an education conference.
2017-04-26.headline_main: On a Par 5 in Dubai, Good Humor and a Respite From All Things Trump

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: Claremont, Calif. — What kind of conservative is President Trump? He must be some kind of conservative, because for nearly 100 days and counting, liberals have poured on him the kind of vitriol they do not reserve for moderates or ideological nobodys. Inside the Beltway, some famous conservatives have joined in the sport but for the opposite reason, that Mr. Trump, they claim, is no conservative but a populist demagogue out to discredit and destroy their beloved movement.

2017-04-26.abstract: Female activists from North and South Korea, and many other countries, wrote to America’s president, saying: “Diplomacy is the only way to resolve the nuclear crisis.”

2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: Traveling with children is many things. Relaxing is not typically among them. The exception is a trip that includes at least some help with child care — time when parents are free to luxuriate in that rarest of parental indulgences: time alone. But finding reliable, affordable child care can be enough of a challenge at home. Where does one even begin to get such help on the road? Here are five strategies for finding the right fit for your family.

2017-04-26.abstract: So much of the pleasure is tied to touch.
2017-04-26.snippet: So much of the pleasure is tied to touch.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: My mother and I had a joke that whatever gene makes a baker skipped her generation. I think the closest she ever came to baking was spearing bright orange peanut-shaped marshmallows on a carving fork and toasting them over the stove. When I married — I was 19 and a college junior — the only culinary experience I could claim was burning down my parents’ kitchen seven years earlier, a misadventure involving frozen fries and boiling oil.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Baking Is All in the Hands

2017-04-26.abstract: For the Frugal Family, the appeal of an all-inclusive resort came from the child care and the possibility of a vacation that would feel like a vacation.
2017-04-26.snippet: For the Frugal Family, the appeal of an all-inclusive resort came from the child care and the possibility of a vacation that would feel like a vacation.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: It was our second night in Jamaica, and I was sitting at a picnic table on a small, rocky beach in Runaway Bay. We were eating a buffet dinner and watching a talent show that combined sideshow stunts by performers — walking on nails and blowing flames into the sky — with gymnastics and G-rated jokes by guests, who included children and a few brave parents. When the crowd applauded, my 18-month-old daughter, Roxie, clapped excitedly with them. In the show’s final act, an otherwise dignified Canadian father with Justin Trudeau-like good looks thrust his pelvis across the makeshift stage as if possessed by the spirit of Elvis Presley.
2017-04-26.headline_main: A Jamaica Trip With the Ultimate Travel Amenity: A Nanny

2017-04-26.abstract: The 74-year-old force behind the avant-garde label Comme des Garçons makes otherworldly clothes that express hidden desires and fears.
2017-04-26.snippet: The 74-year-old force behind the avant-garde label Comme des Garçons makes otherworldly clothes that express hidden desires and fears.
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: Rei Kawakubo is a 74-year-old Japanese designer who has been making monochromatic, boiled, overstuffed, unraveling, surreal clothes since she began her label, Comme des Garçons, in 1969. In the ’80s, an era of triangular fluorescent shoulders and moussed bangs, she sent widow’s weeds trailing down the runway. In the ’90s, her clothes grew tumors that resembled bustles, blurring the lines between illness and beauty, what to look at and what to look away from. While her stores stock simple cotton poplin shirts as well as more challenging lumpen jackets and her runway shows present one-off sculptures, the through-line is a thoughtful rejection of should and a strong feeling of perhaps. The name of her label, which translates to “Like the Boys,” is a quiet, defiant shrug.
2017-04-26.headline_main: Rei Kawakubo, Interpreter of Dreams

2017-04-26.abstract: Michael Weinstein’s AIDS Healthcare Foundation treats an enormous number of patients — and makes an enormous amount of money. Is that why so many activists distrust him?
2017-04-26.snippet: Michael Weinstein’s AIDS Healthcare Foundation treats an enormous number of patients — and makes an enormous amount of money. Is that why so many activists distrust him?
2017-04-26.lead_paragraph: Last May, at the height of the Democratic presidential campaign, two weeks before the California primary, Bernie Sanders flew to San Bernardino, Calif., for a meeting with leading AIDS groups. The gathering was arranged by Peter Staley, the esteemed activist and founder of the Treatment Action Group, which in the 1990s helped speed the development of antiretroviral drugs. The meeting was called to secure the Sanders campaign’s support for a spike in federal spending to combat AIDS, but as the session began, those in attendance were puzzled to find the conversation oddly strained. Sanders’s demeanor, Staley recalled, “was very wary — he was very chilly when we shook hands.” Sanders seemed to be churning internally about something until, dispensing with ceremony, he blurted out: “Let me be blunt. Do any of you get money from the drug companies?”
2017-04-26.headline_main: The C.E.O. of H.I.V.
